loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 27 years old. He and his wife, Emily, have a three-year-old baby. Justus is the breadwinner of the family and he has been repairing electronics in Naivasha town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan. He is planning to buy new tools to replace his old, worn out ones.  

In the future, Justus plans to have a big electronics repair shop, where he will also sell electronics like TV sets and radios.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K. is  33 years old, married to Lucy Wanderi and they have one school going child.

Paul operates a motorcycle taxi business in Naivasha town. He has been doing this business for three years now and it has been sustainig both himself and his family.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan with KADET. He is planning to use the funds to repair his motorbike.

In future, Paul plans to diversify in the transport business and own his own fleet of motor vehicle taxis.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is a 36 years old married man with one daughter. He runs a retail shop and also has cows for dairy farming. He has been running the shop for about 10 years now and he approximates his monthly profit to Kshs 25000. 

He has not borrowed elsewhere but KADET where he has been introduced by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to restock the shop.

Samuel beleives that he is hardworking and he hopes to own a wholesale store and have more cows for dairy farming.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Adding stock for his  retail shop

loans.name: Dorothy  Kasyoka

texts.en:
Dorothy is married to Collins and they have three children Danis, Peter and Anne who are 17, 15 and 12 years old respectively.

Dorothy has been in the business of selling african lessos for one year and her clients are from within the slum area along outering road.

She was introduced to KADET through existing clients and had no previous credit history. She has applied for a loan which she will use to add more materials stock including african lessos.

Her hopes and dreams are to open her own shop and Dorothy describes herself as hardworking and honest.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used  to add more stock of materials

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is a woman with something to prove - to her parents and to others who believed that she would account to nothing because she married very young and had no bankable working skills. Romela is now 34 years old and lives in the village of Purok Camansi, Brgy. Mailum, Bago City, Negros Occidental with her husband who works as a security guard, and their three children.  The oldest is now 17 years old and is studying aeronautics, the second is 16 years old, and is in the fourth year of high school, and the youngest is 11 and is still in elementary school.

When Romela married and got pregnant while still a teenager, her parents were disappointed because they thought all their dreams and aspirations for her would come to naught.  They were worried about how she would survive in the future. Acquaintances and relatives thought that she was throwing her life away. She proved all of them wrong by sheer will, determination and tirelessly working hard along with her husband to make a life for their young family.

While she was pregnant with her first child, her parents decided to close their business of buying and selling firewood and bamboo poles. Seeing an opportunity to help her husband by earning her own living, Romela decided to take over the business operations that her parents were closing up. With only the small amount of capital that her husband could provide, she was able to continue dealing with the same suppliers.  She earned the loyalty of the same customers because they did not have to go somewhere else. By planning her cash flow well, she was able to maintain the business and slowly make it into a stable source of income.

After several years, Romela saw that she needed to earn more if she was to provide her children with a better future. Her problem was where to find the necessary additional capital so that she could expand her business. When someone told her about NWTF-Project Dungganon, she immediately asked her husband's permission to join so that she could access the much-needed additional capital to increase her stocks of firewood and bamboo poles through loans that she could pay in weekly installments. 

Her business grew and she was able to increase her income, allowing her to afford her children's education and save for their future. She used her 3rd cycle loan to purchase a tricycle - a motorcycle with a side car - which she uses in her business, allowing her to make deliveries of the firewood and bamboo poles to her regular customers, increasing her income potential even further.

In the five years since she became an NWTF-Project Dungganon member, her business continues to improve and it earns approximately $225 a month for her family. Her previous loan - the 19th cycle loan amounting Php 10,000 - was used as additional capital for the business and it was fully paid on time without any delays.  For her 20th cycle loan she proposes to get the same amount of Php 10,000 as additional capital for her business. Her future plan is to expand her business and put up a general store.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna B. is from the village of Catarman. She is 42 years old. Erna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Erna is just starting this business.

In 2001, Erna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Erna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Erna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married to Victor, who presently works as a cook in a restaurant. They have four children. The oldest is 26 years old and already has a family, and the youngest is twelve. The three younger children still go to school, and this motivated Gina to earn additional income so that they could pay for the needs of their children. Victor's salary as a cook is just not enough to cover all of their household expenses. 

In her eagerness to help her husband, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have access to loans that would enable her to start a small business. She used the PHP 3,000 first cycle loan to invest in a food vending business, selling a variety of native delicacies within her community. Happy with the results, she continued until she saved enough to put up a general store adjacent to her house, where she sold household commodities that had a fast turnover rate. She's been operating her business for four years now and it earns her an average monthly income of about $115.

The previous 6th cycle loan amounted to Php 12,000. She was able to pay her weekly installments and fully paid it within the loan term. Now for her 7th cycle she is borrowing Php 14,000 to use as revolving working capital for her business, and she also plans to invest some of the loan money into selling dried fish.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her genereal store and food vending

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from the village of Clarin. She is 47 years old. Lolita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business in which the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $46 a month for these activities.

In 2000, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her tenth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu B. is from the village of Bato. She is 44 years old. Marichu is widowed and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Marichu joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Marichu from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 26-year-old young man who was orphaned as a child and raised by his grandmother. He is now married and has a five-year old daughter. 

Eric has been running a charcoal business for the last three and a half years after getting capital to start his business from his uncle. He was then introduced to KADET by an existing member after wanting to get more funds to expand his business. This is Eric's first loan through KADET and he wants to use it to purchase a motorbike to help with transporting the charcoal and maize (that he does on the side). Eric hopes to use the extra profit generated as a result of this loan to acquire an additional piece of land and educate his daughter. 

His future hope is to eventually be able to uplift the living standard of his family.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting his charcoal stock

loans.name: God's Mercy Group

texts.en:
God's Mercy is a group of five borrowers led by Marie S.. She is 40 years old and married with four children aged 8-23 years old. Their educational levels are 8th grade through high school graduate. Marie also cares for two siblings. Marie graduated from high school but couldn't continue due to poverty. She lives in WestPoint close to down town Monrovia, Liberia. WestPoint is known for its population and its level when it comes to crime rate and poverty.

Marie's business is her provision shop. She buys goods like matches, candles, insecticides, bread, eggs, butter etc. wholesale and sells them at retail to the residents of WestPoint. Marie started this business with the sales of tomatoes, canned food and other simple goods on a table, but now she has grown to owning a shop. She has been running this business for more than 20 years. Marie feels what brought her this far is giving her customers good service and talking to them in a good manner so when they leave her they will always want to come and buy from her.
She needs this loan to purchase goods, have a good foundation and continue. Marie hopes to promote her business to a higher level and own a store. And she dreams of a big house for her and her family in order to change their lives completely.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian B. lives in the village of Sitio Coop, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. She is 35 years old and married to Eulogio B., who is presently employed as Kabo (supervisor) in a sugarcane plantation. They have an adopted child, Jasmine, who is eight years old. The couple is still hoping to have their own baby someday. Even though she has a small family, Vivian still prepares for their future. She still helps her husband raise their weekly income. 

The family has their own small rice farm that supports the food needs of the family. This gave Vivian the idea to make the rice field more productive. In the year 2002 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have capital for her farm to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor. Since the rice is harvested after three months, Vivian worked in the sugarcane plantation in the meantime. After harvesting the rice, she had it milled and sold it to the people in her community and also to the sugarcane workers. The rice business earns an average of PHP 4,000 per month, which is enough for her small family, with savings left for their future security.

Her previous loan of Php 17,000 was used as working capital for her farm. She paid all of her weekly installments on time and the loan was fully paid within the loan term, maintaining her status as a good member of NWTF_Project Dungganon. Now she is borrowing Php 19,000 to add to her capital for her rice farm to have a better living standard in the future.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Isily

texts.en:
Mrs. Isily B. is from Sitio Napulo, part of Barangay Cervantes in the city of Escalante. She is married with two children, seven months and four years of age. After her marriage Mrs. Isily B. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and started her and her husband’s fishing boat business with 3,000 PHP.

Now their small business is stable, and they need additional capital for expansion. Mrs. B. is now requesting a seventh loan through NWTF, this one for 6,000 PHP to boost the working capital of their fishing business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Kpatikomai Group

texts.en:
Kpatikomai is a group of 5 borrowers led by Jusu J. M., who is 28 years old. He has completed high school and is preparing for university, while taking care of his 6 year-old son and a nephew at the same time. Jusu lives in Vai Town, Monrovia, Liberia. His community is very crowded and has a high poverty rate, which pushes the residents to get involved in many different means of generating income.

Jusu is in the garment business. He buys textiles, sews clothes and sells the clothes to the residents of Vai Town. In seventh grade, Jusu struggled to learn how to how to sew but since he started to sew on his own, he has been creating quality designs.

Jusu wants to eventually buy a piece of land on which he can build a home and a business storefront. He also dreams of having a well plan and established family. Jusu needs the loan to buy more sewing materials to continue his garment business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to expand business.

loans.name: Delivina

texts.en:
Although she is 67 years old, Delivina T. still wants to continue to be independent and self-sufficient. She is married to Basilio, who is 69 years old and retired. They have nine grown children - all of whom have their own families. Delivina and Basilio live in the town of Moises Padilla in the province of Negros Occidental.

Delivina owns a food vending business that sells "Inasal" - charcoal grilled barbecued meats like hotdogs, pork strips, beef tocino, and even solidified pork blood, which is a popular native delicacy. Her food stand is quite popular in her neighborhood and has enabled her to save enough to establish a general store adjacent to her house. She also makes and sells banana cue. Banana cue is made of fried bananas on skewers that are coated with sugar and cooked until the sugar caramelizes.

The income her business generates helps her cover household expenses. Over the years, she has been able to pay to build her house and to create a savings for future security. Although she's been in this business for over 20 years now, she still enjoys managing the daily activities. She now earns about PHP 9,000 per month. Her last loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon was her 19th one and she borrowed PHP 19,500, which she used as additional capital for her business. This time around, she intends to borrow PHP 22,000 for her 20th cycle to reinvest further into her food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mighty Power Group

texts.en:
Mighty Power is a group of 5 borrowers led by Akine S. who is 34 years old and has a high school degree. Akine has a 5 year-old child who is in kindergarten. He lives in West Point, Monrovia, Liberia. This community is very crowded and has a high poverty rate which pushes its residents to try many different ways to make a living.

Akine sells dry goods such as milk, sugar, and ovaltine. Before, Akine was a laborer, pushing wheelbarrows, but he later realized that he needed to own his own business. He has been operating this business for four years and still hopes for greater improvement. Akine has developed a good relationship with his customers because he is polite to them.

He hopes to eventually expand his business into a big store. Akine dreams of being able to provide for his family such that his child has a solid education and they all have better health care. He needs this loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Marbell Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario Marbell está formado por Ada Francis B. Jiménez, Martha Cedemia C. L. y Jessenia del Socorro J. C., provenientes de Masaya, del barrio llamado Monimbo. 

La coordinadora del grupo es Ada de 24 años de edad, quien posee una pulpería bastante surtida en su casa, esto desde hace mas de 2 años, que se motivó a hacerlo debido a que hay un colegio cerca de sucasa y los niños mucho buscan golosinas.

Así inició la venta de frutas, golosinas y actualmente ha logrado surtir el  negocio mucho más. Su meta es logra invertir en productos de uso higiénico como papel higiénico, jabones de baño, perfumes, etc.

Martha C. vende artesanías de madera, cerámicas y hamacas y Jessenia J. vende ropa de manera ambulante en el mercado de Managua.
texts.en:
The Marbell Solidarity Group is comprised of Ada Francis B. Jiménez, Martha Cedemia C. L., and Jessenia del Socorro J. C.. They are from Masaya and live in the neighborhood of Monimbo.

Ada is 24 years old and the group coordinator. For two years, she has operated a grocery store out of her home that is adequately stocked. Her house is located near a school, so she was motivated to start her business because the children are always looking to buy candy. In addition to sweets, she also sells fruit and is looking to add more products to her inventory. Her goal is to acquire hygiene products such as toilet paper, bath soaps, perfumes, etc.

Martha C. sells wooden handicrafts, ceramics, and hammocks. Jessenia J. sells clothing as a traveling merchant at the market in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional products to restock their businesses

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Grace Group consists of five borrowers led by 39-year-old Jonas Q.. He is married and has three children, ages two to eighteen years old, with some attending classes from kindergarten to ninth grade. He is a high school graduate but couldn't continue his education due to lack of financial support from his parents.

Jonas and his family live in West Point, close to downtown Monrovia in Liberia. West Point is a very crowded community, so life is difficult there. As a result of hardship and poverty, the crime rate is very high in West Point; therefore, most people living there wish they could afford to relocate.

Jonas’s business is importing goods for personal use from Ghana and selling them to the residents of West Point. This business enables him to feed and care for his entire family. Jonas has been running this business for over eight years, and giving his customers quality goods is what has brought him this far. 

While Jonas started this business with a small amount of cash, it is now growing, and he would like to establish a big store. He needs and is requesting this loan in order to import more goods from Ghana.

Jonas's dream is for his children to become well educated and have a good future.

loans.use: To import more goods from Ghana

loans.name: Aquiles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es originario del Centro de Masaya, del barrio pancasan ubicado a orillas del mercado central. Aracelly de 19 años de edad, ubicada a la izquierda de la foto, es una joven universitaria, trabajadora y muy independiente.

Es estudiante de medicina, y como medio para costear sus gastos universitarios, vende zapatos fabricados en Masaya para enfermeras. Los distribuye en la Universidad a las estudiantes de enfermería y en algunos colegios. Su hermana le ayuda a vender puesto que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes.

Su meta es lograr acrecentar su negocio a través de los créditos que se le faciliten. “Lo que hago es invertir más para ver más ganancias y lograr terminar mi carrera con éxito” dice Aracelly.

Tania L. hace y distribuye helados o sorbetes artesanales, de mucha demanda en la ciudad y muy famosos. Nidia
texts.en:
This group is originally from the neighborhood of Pancasan, which is located near the main market in central Masaya. Aracelly (the woman pictured on the left) is 19 years old. She is a hardworking and independent young woman.

Aracelly is a medical student. In order to pay for her education expenses, she sells nurses’ shoes that are manufactured in Masaya. She sells them to nursing students at the university and at other schools. Her sister helps with selling her products since they are in great demand by her customers.

She hopes to grow her business through the loans that have been provided. “I hope to invest more into my business so that I can earn more money and end my career (as a saleswoman) successfully,” says Aracelly.

Tania L. makes and distributes her famous ice cream and sorbets, which are in high demand throughout the city. Nidia

loans.use: Purchase additional products

loans.name: Benita Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Benita Ángela M. de 58 años de edad trabaja en la compra venta de frutas y verduras. Ella compra las cosechas en la ciudad de Masaya y las lleva a Esteli. Aprovechando el viaje nos dice que siempre trae productos para vender, como papa, frijoles.

Inició su negocio a partir de la venta de una propiedad que poseía, y una amiga la motivo en invertir de esta forma. Lo hiso y no se arrepiente puesto que es un negocio muy bueno. Agradece los créditos que se le han dado puesto que le han permitido mantener su negocio en pié y tener la facilidad de adquirir accesorios para la comodidad en su hogar.

Su mayor anhelo es apoyar a su hija en poner un salón de belleza, ya que le gusta mucho esta profesión y se está especializando en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita is 58 years old. She works buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She buys the harvests in the city of Masaya and takes them to Esteli. She takes advantage of the trip to bring products to sell such as potatoes, beans, etc. She began her business after selling a property that she owned. Her girlfriend motivated her to invest in this business. She did this and she hasn’t regretted this, as it has been a good business. She is thankful to the banks that have allowed her to maintain her active business and have the means to acquire the extras needed for a comfortable home. Her main desire is to support her daughter in starting a beauty salon because she likes this profession and is specializing in this area.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio Cesar E. de 63 años de edad, es un varon muy jovial y trabajador; Desde hace mas de 40 años trabaja en zapatería. Elabora calzado y lo distribuye en diferentes zonas del país. 

Esta profesión la aprendió de sus padres,  quienes en tiempos pasados se esmeraban en enseñar a sus hijos a trabajar en lo que ellos trabajaban. Así aprendió e inicio su propio taller desde muy joven para poder independizarse de sus padres y formar su familia.

Padre de 5 hijos ya mayores de edad, agradece los créditos que ha tenido puesto que le han permitido tener su propia instrumentaría, ya que cuando inicio, alquilaba las maquinas para poder sacar su producción.  Ahora cuenta con sus propias maquinas. Pese a que tuvo muchas pérdidas con la devaluación de la moneda, ha logrado levantar su negocio gracias a los créditos facilitados. 

Este crédito pretende invertirlo en material para bota militar, ya que en invierno se vende bastante y ya tiene pedidos de éstas.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Grupo Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Camino a la Luz es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, del municipio de Tisma ubicado a 17 Km de la ciudad de Masaya. Está formado por Elena Patricia M. G., Blanca Azucena G. y María Auxiliadora C..

Elena es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 23 años de edad y es madre de una niña de 2 años; por quien trabaja muy duro, para lograr darle un nivel de vida mejor que el que ella tuvo. Elena trabaja en la elaboración e cajetas (de coco, leche, maní, papaya) y otra variedad de postres como atol, arroz con leche, que distribuye en su comarca.

Aparte trabaja planchando ropa y comprando arboles que convierte en leña y distribuye en pulperías y tortillerías, se esfuerza mucho por conseguir ingresos que le permitan brindarle a su hija las necesidades básicas.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en el negocio de la leña, ya que le resulta muy bueno, está orgullosa de sus logros puesto que ha podido levantar su humilde casa con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de su esposo.

Blanca vende refrescos de frutas y bebidas gaseosas en su casa de habitación, además de vender golosinas y María C. vende comida en su casa.

loans.use: compra de arboles para leña

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José Sánchez Hernández , tiene la edad de 49 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos de 25, 20 y 18 años de edad, el mayor es casado  e independiente , los demás estudiante de secundaria , los planes hacia su familia es apoyar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales , don Rolando desde hace 31 años trabaja como agricultor  ya que sus padres le heredaron y le han sacado mucho provecho a sus cultivos , esta muy contento por el apoyo que le hemos brindado durante once ciclo el cual comprara abonos, venenos para fumigar el cultivo y poder eliminar cualquier plaga, con esto obtendrá unos frutos hermosos . Agradece ala institución por su buena aprobación con el financiamiento ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos préstamos y que solo mediante este medio se puede prosperar debido a la crisis económica que se enfrenta el país.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y venenos para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Santa Amalia Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe C. B. de 25 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo Santa Amalia, quien a su edad es una mujer “Pilas Puestas” como ella lo describe. Trabaja en el destace de cerdos.

Aprendió esto de su suegra quien la motivo y le enseño el negocio; compra los cerdos y los da a destazar para después ella distribuir la carne. Ahora que ha hecho clientela, tiene mucha demanda de carne y desea invertir su crédito en acrecentar el negocio.

Cruz V. P. y Gretches del Carmen P. trabajan en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya. Son un grupo muy disciplinado en sus cuotas y de un excelente record crediticio.

loans.use: Para la compra de cerdo

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa R., tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como agricultor y comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tiene un hijo varón de siete años , actualmente el niño estudio su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios , doña Maria desde hace nueve años se dedica a la agricultura ; ya que su mamá le apoyo para que trabajara las tierras , antes que ella se dedicará a  los cultivo era ama de casa, y abecés no ajustaban con los ingresos que su esposo. Ella con el primer desembolso logro mejorar sus cultivo y gracias a las instrucciones del técnico obtuvo una mejor producción y logro cancelar en tiempo y forma. Agradece ala institución por su buena aprobación con el segundo financiamiento el cual comprara fertilizante para abonar al cultivo de piña el cual espera vender a buen precio y tener buenas ganancias y llevar a  cabo sus objetivos.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y poder abonor el cultivo de piña

loans.name: Laguna Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo Laguna Verde proviene de la ciudad de Masaya, está formado por Silvia Antonia B. L., María Luisa B. y Guillermo Antonio T. S..

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Silvia, quien elabora y vende sobreros típicos, de dos tipos; para niños (De juguete) y de adulto (Finos, usados por los jinetes en las fiestas hípicas). Aprendió dicho oficio de su mamá, quien los hacía y salía a venderlos en las fiestas patronales de los departamentos. Actualmente Silvia no sale a venderlos, puesto que llegan a comprárselos en cantidades grandes, los que van a vender a los departamentos.

Su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sombreros de niño puesto que se aproxima una época de mucha demanda de éstos.

María Luisa B. de 38 años de edad tiene una pulpería en su casa y don Guillermo Antonio T. elabora calzado.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña  Juana Francisca Torres, tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio, Pablo Calero, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos el mayor ya casado e independiente, los menores actualmente estudia y en sus tiempos libres le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas, doña Juana desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura ya que ella fue unas de las beneficiadas  con el programa de la reforma agraria, la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo de piña son los gases del volcán . La señora Juana esta contenta con los interese que son bajos y la aprobación de once créditos ya que durante este tiempo logro tener buenas producciones y cancelas en el tiempo establecido; a la vez con lo que le queda a establecido una manzana mas de cultivo, sus planes es lograr construir su casa ya que la que tiene actualmente es de madera y desea tener una casa seguro para proteger a su familia. con este crédito invertirá en la compra de abonos para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado

loans.use: Comprar abono y mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: El Arrollo Group

texts.es:
Sonia María S. N., Patricia del Carmen L. P. y Aura Lina R. N. son los integrantes del grupo el arrollo, provenientes de la comarca laguna Verde ubicada en la carretera que lleva de Granada a Masaya.

Sonia S. de 52 años de edad y situada al centro de la fotografía, trabaja en un negocio que heredó de su familia. Que es la compra de cosechas de frutas  y verduras que vende a los mercaderes en la ciudad de Masaya.

Su credito lo quiere para invertir en cosechas frescas que sacaran ahorita los agricultores, esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y crecer en clientela.

Patricia L.  tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda y Aura Lina R. elabora cereales y los distribuye en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
Sonia María S. N., Patricia del Carmen L. P. and Aura Lina R. N. are members of the group "El Arrollo." They come from the community of Laguna Verde located off the road between Granada and Masaya. Sonia S. is 52 years old, and is the person in the center of the photograph. She works in a business that she inherited from her family that involves the purchase of fruits and vegetables that are sold in the markets of the City of Masaya. Her loan will be used to purchase the fresh produce that farm workers are currently harvesting. This will permit her to increase her income and her customer base. Patricia L. has a business selling second-hand clothes and Aura Lina R. processes cereals and distributes them in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fresh produce

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es:
Nubia Auxiliadora O. trabaja en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Managua desde hace 5 años. Oficio que aprendió de su abuela que tiene un tramo en éste mercado. Así inicio vendiendo mangos, con los créditos que ADM le ha dado ha logrado invertir y surtir su negocio. 

Anhela tener su tramo propio, ya que alquila un pequeño lugar y pretende lograrlo con los financiamientos que se le den y así poder terminar de construir su casa para bridarle mejores condiciones a su hija.

Con su crédito invertirá en cosechas de yuca y quequisque. Consuelo P. cría cerdo y los vende una vez que están listos para matarse y Matilde contra y vende frutas y verduras.

loans.use: Frutas y Verduras

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Félix Rubén M. habita en el Km. 10 ½  Carretera a Masaya junto a su esposa e hijos, la esposa trabaja como conserje en el colegio San Antonio Sur, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, don Félix M. desde hace 15 años es docente del mismo colegio imparte clases a niños de primaria  por las mañanas y por las tardes es profesor de educación física del mismo colegio. El esta contento ya que tiene cinco ciclos trabajando con la institución ya que los interés son bajos y le apoyan al sector educación, su sueldo no le ajusta para poder mejorar su vivienda de una solo vez, él se siente casi realizado ya que gran parte de su casa esta casi termina, con esta aprobación va a comprar el piso y parte del techo. Agradece ala institución por su buena confianza que le dan a los clientes que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos préstamos.

loans.use: Comprar piso y zinc para repara el techo de su vivienda

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora Z., who is 47 years old. She lives in Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Felimon, 49, is a truck driver.  They have three adult children; one stays at home, another one is in college and the youngest is still in high school.

Leonora provides a home service doing manicures, pedicures and foot spas. She takes pride in her line of work because she was able to send her eldest child to college. Half of her life has been devoted to doing her work. She is also into buying and selling window curtains.  She earns 11,000 Philippine pesos of net income per month.  

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She is now on her sixth loan cycle and has just recently applied for a loan in the amount of P19,000. She will use the funds to buy a new manicure set, nail colors (polish), foot-spa medicated solution and other supplies for her business.

Leonora wishes to have her own house and lot where she and her children can live happily. She is also working hard to pursue her other childrens' education.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy a manicure set and other beauty-care products

loans.name: Jose Ausberto

texts.es:
el señor Jose A. M. tiene 53 años de edad, el tiene un taxi, su punto para recoger personas es en el mall las Cascadas de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, el tiene un permiso para trabajar en ese lugar y pertenece a una asociacion de taxis llamada ASCAMUNT, son mas de 20 socios, el objetivo es darles transporte a muchas personas que visitan dicho mall, tambien tienen contratos con personas que trabajan en dicho mall, los llevan en horas de entrada y salida de sus trabajos.
Jose es casado y tiene 4 hijos.
ahora necesita el dinero para poder reparar el motor del taxi, ya que empieza a darle problemas.
su meta es comprar varias unidades de taxi y asi poder defenderse en un futuro.

loans.use: repuestos para reparar motor del taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gerardo Ramón

texts.es:
Gerardo Ramón S. R. es originario de la ciudad de Granada, llamada por los nicaragüenses “La Gran Sultana”, por su volcán, antiguamente conocido como “El Sultán”.

Gerardo posee dos tipos de negocios que le han permitido salir adelante, subsistir y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El primero es la agricultura, que realiza desde hace más de quince años; Posee 5 manzanas de tierra y siembra Maíz, frijoles y yuca. En este tipo de negocio la ganancia se mira a largo plazo, por lo tanto como el mismo dice “Por la necesidad” tomó la iniciativa de invertir en otro tipo de negocio a menor plazo, éste es la compra de arboles para leña.

Inició con 5 fletes de leña; pero con los créditos que se le han proporcionado y el trabajo que el realiza, actualmente trabaja hasta con 20 fletes de leña. Su meta es llegar a los 130 fletes. 

Leva 25 ciclos de crédito con ADIM, más de 6 años de trabajar con la institución y se siente muy satisfecho, orgulloso de sus logros y cree que va a alcanzar sus metas pronto, puesto que como el mismo dice “Me ha ido bonito”.
texts.en:
Gerardo Ramón S. R. is originally from the city of Grenada, which is called “The Great Sultan” by Nicaraguans because of its ancient volcano known as “the Sultan”.

Gerardo has managed two businesses in order to get ahead, survive, and improve his quality of life. His first business is in agriculture, which he started more than 15 years ago. He owns 5 plots of land for planting corn, beans, and cassava. This is his long-term business that serves as his primary source of income. He took the initiative to start another business out of necessity, buying timber used for firewood. Originally he started with 5 shipments of wood, but loans have helped him acquire up to 20 shipments at a time. His goal is to be able to handle 130 shipments.

Gerardo has already taken out 25 loans from ADIM over a 6 year relationship with the Institution. He is very happy and proud of his accomplishments. He believes he will reach his goals soon because he keeps telling himself, “You can do this.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood & supplies for planting corn, beans, and cassava

loans.name: Ericka Vanesa

texts.es: La joven Erika V. C., tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio El Edén, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista ellos tienen dos hijos de doce años y ocho, actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Erika desde hace 17 años se dedica a la agricultura , ya que su esposo le apoyo para que cultivara las tierras que le heredo sus padres y así poder trabajar y obtener un mejor ingreso , ella esta contenta a pesar de las dificultades que paso , por que cuando inicio paso por muchas dificultades , pero gracias al financiamiento que obtuvo en Afodenic ha mejorado sus cultivo y se siente muy agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado durante seis ciclo el cual comprara fertilizantes y poder aplicar al cultivo , con esto espera tener buenos frutos y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes y mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Araceli del Carmen Ríos de 32 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad, el cual estudian para un porvenir mejor de sus vidas. Su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos, gaseosas, golosinas y cosmético es como una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio lo comenzó con dinero que su esposo dio y con financiamiento que Afodenic dio es su décimo ciclo y ha logrado invertir para surtir su negocio y aumentar las ventas. Su esposo tiene dos camiones en donde vende arena, piedrin y piedra cantera y algún viaje que le salga hace ya que todo es entrada de ingresos. La señora Araceli invertirá con este préstamo en la compra de granos básicos y productos de cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de productos, lo cual espera aumentar las ventas y obtener mejores resultado. Ya que sus planes es poder seguir construyendo su vivienda para dar una casa digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Araceli del Carmen Ríos is 32 years old. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has two children, aged 6 and 9, who study for better lives and wellbeing. Her business is in the sales of milk products, sodas, candies and cosmetics like a small general store. She started this business with money that her husband gave her and with financing from Afodenic. This is her tenth cycle, and she has been able to invest in her business to supply it and increase her sales. Her husband has two trucks from which he sells sand, gravel and quarry rock and makes trips to obtain them, so everything is profit. Araceli will invest this loan in the purchase of basic grains and cosmetic goods to offer her customers a variety of products, which she hopes will increase her sales and outcome. Her plan is to continue constructing her house to give a decent home to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, milk products,  cosmetics and others to increase her sales

loans.name: Unidas Por Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Unidas Por Fe, es originario de la comarca Valle de la laguna, ubicada en zonas cercanas a la laguna de apoyo. Es su cuarto ciclo crediticio y están muy satisfechas de sus logros alcanzados.

Justa Pastora Sanchez es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 46 años de edad y su negocio es la compra  venta de escobas artesanales (de trigo) y Esponjas de baño (artesanales). Trabaja en esto desde hace 22 años e inicio el negocio a raíz de que su prima, quien trabaja también en esto le motivara a iniciar con su propio capital la venta de estos artículos.

Se compran por temporada y se almacenan para vender en el transcurso del año, es por esto que requiere su crédito para comprar grandes cantidades y almacenarlos y venderlos poco a poco.  Así saca las cuotas poco a poco y de esta manera mira sus ganancias distribuidas en el transcurso  del mes.

Guillermina trabaja distribuye especias en las diferentes pulperías y negocios de la comarca y Digna realiza cereales a base de maíz y tortillas.

loans.use: Compra de Productos

loans.name: Los Naranjos3303974 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Naranjos tiene un año de trabajar con adim y está integrado por Abismael Arsenio M. M., Francisca Teodora Velázquez L. y Lino Nemesio Velásquez L.. Ellos son provenientes del municipio de Nindiri.

El coordinador del grupo es  Abismael Arsenio M. M. tiene 37 años de edad el tiene una pequeña sastrería desde hace cuatro años en la comarca Buena Vista. Él desea aumentar sus ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, tijeras, botones entre otros materiales.

Los otros dos integrantes del grupo son Francisca Teodora Velázquez L. de 62 años que desde hace doce años trabaja vendiendo verduras en el M. de Masaya y Lino Nemecio Velásquez L. de 41 año quien es vendedor ambulante de verduras en el M. oriental.

Ambos desean invertir su préstamo en la compra de verduras como yuca, chayote, ayote, pipián, zanahoria…etc.

loans.use: Para adquirir materiales como telas, hilos etc. para realizar trajes

loans.name: El Oriente Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Oriente tiene dos años de trabajar con adim y está conformado por cuatro mujeres excepcionales, trabajadoras y con deseos de superación estas son Rosa Virginia F., Elivee T. M., Ana Paulina P. y Ángela Dominga S. L.. Estas son provenientes de la comarca Guanacastillo zona rural de Masaya.

La coordinadora del Grupo es Rosa Virginia F. de 60 años de edad. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio donde fabrica y vende  sartenes, moldes de reposterías y tablas desde hace doce años, actualmente con la ayuda de adim y la cooperación de su esposo y nieto el negocio ha ido prosperando, es conocido en varios puntos del país. 

F. desea que su negocio crezca para ello invertirá su préstamo en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de  sartenes como lata, remache, alambre, tabla entre otros.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elivee T. M. de 28 años quien vende perfumes de la marca Avon que es muy reconocida en Nicaragua, Ana Paulina P. de 45 años de edad que vende perfumes de la marca Zermat y Ángela Dominga S. L. tiene un negocio muy diverso ella vende cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, chiverías, hielo y frescos.

Todas ellas desean poder seguir trabajando en sus negocios e invertir en la compara de materia prima para ellos.
texts.en:
The “Oriente” (Eastern) Group has been working with ADIM for four years and consists of four exceptional members. These hardworking and determined women are Rosa Virginia F., Elivee T. M., Ana Paulina P., and Ángela Dominga S. L.. They are from the rural district of Guanacastillo which in Masaya.

Rosa Virginia F. is 60 years old and the group coordinator. For 12 years, she has operated a small business where she manufactures and sells frying pans, pastry molds, and chopping boards. She currently has the support of ADIM and the assistance of her husband and grandson. Her business is thriving and well-known in different parts of the country.

Sra. Rosa wants to grow her business and will use her loan to purchase materials used in making frying pans such as tin, rivets, wire, metal sheets, etc.

There are three other members of the group. Elivee T. M. is 28 years old and sells perfumes made by Avon that are recognized in Nicaragua. Ana Paulina P. is 45 years old and sells perfumes made by Zermat. Ángela Dominga S. L. has a diversified business selling cosmetics, perfumes, crèmes, snacks, ice, and soft drinks.

They all want to continue working at their businesses and invest in more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making frying pans

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
la señora Maria A. tiene 56 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de comidas, el cual esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores en el centro de nuestra ciudad capital, sus clientes son personas que trabajan cerca de la zona, les vende al credito por mes.
antes ella solo vendia golosinas y burritas de carne, pero ahora vende desayunos y almuerzos. su negocio tiene buena presentacion y es muy higienico.
tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio el cual es y sera el pilar para sostner su hogar y mantener su familia. ella vive con su esposo ya que sus 4 hijos estan grandes y casados.
su esposo le ayuda a ir a comprar los alimentos que ella necesita para cocinar todos los dias, tambien el le ayuda en ir a dejar los almuerzos a personas que hacen encargos diarios en diferentes empresas estatales y privadas.
su meta es poder hacer mas grande su negocio y asi tener mas ganancias y poder remodelar su casa como ella desea.

loans.use: compra de refrescos, carnes de cerdo, res y pollo, toritllas, manteca, especias, sal, aceite, vegetales, lacteos, emutidos, jugos, galletas, pan, platos, vasos y tenedores desechables, salsas,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: El Mamón Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del Grupo El mamón son Filena del Rosario
texts.en: The members of “El Mamón” Group are Filena del Rosario

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Florida  esta conformado por Rosa Argentina L., Aracely del Carmen M. M. y Pablo R.. Ellos viven en el casco urbano de Nindiri municipio de Masaya.  

La coordinadora del grupo es Rosa Argentina L. de 44 años quien fabrica y vende zapatos en el mercado de Masaya. Ella inicio su negocio familias por medio de préstamos y actualmente tiene dos tR. en el mercado y la fabrica que son atendidos por su hermana, esposo e hijos. 

L. esta muy satisfecha de trabajar con adim porque no es cara y es semanal. Además ella sueña superarse, que su negocio crezca y que su familia este bien.

loans.use: Para comprar materiales para fabricar zapatos como cuero, pega, hilo

loans.name: Misericordia Del Señor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Misericordia del Señor esta integrado por Gloria Elena F., Carla B.  y Ruth María Alarton. Ellas son provenientes de la comarca los altos.

La coordinadora del grupo es Gloria Elena F. de 39 años de edad quien desde hace seis años vende ropa en la zona franca de Masaya. Ella comenzó comprando y vendiendo poca mercadería y ahora compra por docena. Esta señora desea invertir su préstamo para adquirí las nuevas tendencias de la moda en camisetas, pantalones, blusas, Jean entre otras.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Carla B. de 28 años quien vende ropa y Ruth María Alarton de 41años quien vende nacatamales, cosa de horno, gaseosa y frescos. Ambas desean poder reinvertir en sus negocios ya que se aproxima la época de mayor de manda.
texts.en:
The group Misericordia [Mercy] is made up by Gloria Elena F., Carla B., and Ruth María Alarton. They are from the Comarca Los Altos region.

The group coordinator is Gloria Elena F. who is 39 years old, and has sold clothing for the past six years in the Free Trade Zone of Masaya. She began buying and selling small quantities of merchandise and now buys by the dozen. She wishes to invest her loan to acquire the newest clothing trends in shirts, pants, blouses, and jeans, amongst other things.

The other group members are Carla B. who is 28 years old and sells clothing, and Ruth María Alarton who is 41 years and sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales], baked goods, soft drinks, and fruit drinks. Both wish to invest in their businesses given that the season of highest demand is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing in different styles.

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
Don José Roberto C. P. de 37 años de edad es un pequeño agricultor, quien se dedica específicamente a la siembra de Sandías y frijoles. Oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeño, de su papá y sus tíos quienes se dedican al mismo trabajo.

Hace 14 años se independizo de su familia paterna e inicio su negocio con la convicción de sacar adelante a su familia. Algo que ha logrado con mucho orgullo, puesto que alega tiene muchas cosas que ha adquirido gracias a los avances que ha tenido con los financiamientos.

Su mayor anhelo es tener su parcela de tierra, ya que donde siembra son tierras que alquila. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus tres hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años y aun que alega que en este negocio se tienen altibajos por las bajas o alzas en los precios, ha podido superarse en gran manera y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Este crédito lo invertirá en la siembra de Sandia, es su noveno ciclo y posee un record crediticio muy bueno del cual se siente muy orgulloso.

loans.use: Compra de prductos para sembrar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for painting his taxi

loans.name: Mis Jardines Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mis Jardines esta integrado María Isabel S. Rodríguez, Alberto Hernández y  Ángela del Socorro L. J.. Ellos son personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y luchadoras provenientes de los altos.

La coordinadora del grupo es María Isabel S. Rodríguez de 24 años de edad. Ella empezó vendiendo pequeñas cosas por encargo como ropa interior pero poca a poco ha ido introduciendo ropas de todo tipo y cosméticos.  Ella desea invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa con las últimas tendencias y aprovechar la temporada de Diciembre.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Alberto Hernández de 28 años de edad quien tiene un taxi  y  Ángela del Socorro L. J. de 52 años que desde la edad de 20 años vende tortilla, cajeta, buñuelos, cosa de horno entre otros productos lo que le ayudo en la crianza de sus hijos
texts.en:
The group Mis Jardines [My Gardens] is made up by María Isabel S. Rodríguez, Alberto Hernández y Ángela del Socorro L. J.. They are people that work hard, strive, and struggle to get ahead, and come from the Los Altos region.

The group coordinator is María Isabel S. Rodríguez who is 24 years old. She began selling small things on order, such as underwear, but little by little she has introduced all types of clothing and cosmetics. She wishes to invest in the purchase of an assortment of clothing in the latest trends, and to take advantage of the season in December.

The other group members are Alberto Hernández who is 28 years old and owns a taxi, and Ángela del Socorro L. J. who is 52 years old, and since she was 20 years old has sold tortillas, cajeta [caramel cream made with goat's milk], buñuelos [sweet donut like dumplings], and baked goods, amongst other products that have helped her raise her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new styles of clothing.

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Rojo está conformado por Silvia Gabriela O. M., Jahiro Antonio Sevillana y Emma Ramira Sánchez M.. Ellos son provenientes de la zona 2 de Nindiri.

La coordinadora del grupo es Silvia Gabriela O. M. de 34 años de edad, ella desde hace dos años empezó en su hogar con el negocio de recargas y ventas de teléfonos de la compañía telefónica Movistar. O. a segura que ha tenido varias mejoras en su negocio gracias a los créditos  y desea que en un futuro no muy lejano esta sea una gran destruidora de celulares. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Jahiro Antonio Sevillana  de 40 años quien tiene un pequeño bar  y Emma Ramira Sánchez M. de 22 años quien vende licor. Todos ellos necesitan del crédito para invertir en la materia prima para su negocio.

loans.use: Para comprar telefonos y recarga

loans.name: La Prueba Group

texts.es:
El grupo la prueba está conformado por tres mujeres excepcionales que desean salir a delante y trabajar arduamente por ellas y sus familias, estas son: 

Reyna Espinosa de 39 años de edad quien trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental desde los 7 años. El sueño de ella es poder tener su propio tramo y que sus hijos logren prepararse. 

Sonia Esperanza R. tiene un pequeño puesto de verduras en su pueblo Reparto Roberto Lara  que es de la zona rural de Nindiri y Simona del Carmen L. que vende raspado, un postre típico nicaragüense de hielo y miel en las calles de Masaya.

Ellas invertirán su crédito en la compra de materia prima para su puesto como yuca, ayote, pián, pepino, tomate , naranja, pitaya y piña entre otros.
texts.en:
The Group La Prueba is composed of three exceptional women that wish to get ahead in life and work arduously for themselves and their families. They are as follows:

Reyna Espinosa is 39 years old and has worked selling fruits and vegetables in the Mercado Oriental for the past 7 years. She dreams of setting up her own stall and that her children receive an education.

Sonia Esperanza R. has a small vegetable stand in her town of Reparto Roberto Lara, which is located in the rural zone Nindiri. Simona del Carmen L. sells ‘raspado’, a traditional Nicaraguan desert that consists of shaved ice and honey sold on the streets of Masaya.

They will invest their loan in the purchase of basic materials for their stand, such as yucca, chayote, zucchini, cucumber, tomatoes, oranges, dragon fruit, and pineapple, amongst others.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials for their stand, such as yucca, chayote, zucchini, cucumber, tomatoes, oranges, dragon fruit, and pineapple, amongst others.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel es casado con la señora Petra y viven solitos ya que todos sus hijos ya se casaron, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y de su esposo, el tiene su negocio de venta de rusas (refresco con frutas y chile en polvo) y gorditas de picadillo, chile colorado etc. 
El motivo por el que están solicitando su crédito es para la compra de más mercancía de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos consumibles.

loans.use: Compra de mercancia para elaborar sus productos

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio es casado con la señora Irma Yolanda y son padres de 2 hijos en edad escolar. El labora para un taller de soldadura desde hace 2 años. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de su vivienda ya que sus hijos están creciendo y desean tener mas espacio para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio is married to Irma Yolanda and they are parents to 2 school-aged children. He has worked at a welding shop for the past 2 years. They are requesting this loan to expand their house given that their children are growing and they would like to have more room to provide more comfort for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their house.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario las Vecinas está formado por 4 amigas de confianza, que se conocen desde hace más de 10 años. Vecinas de su comarca ubicada adelante del municipio de Tisma.

Blanca Rosa A. es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene treinta y ocho años de edad y es la primera ubicada en la parte derecha de la foto. Trabaja en la venta de ropa y cosméticos tanto en la Zona Franca de Tipitapa como en su casa, donde tiene una pequeña tienda, pero que todavía no cuenta con las condiciones pertinentes.

Su crédito lo quiere para invertir en las demandas de sus clientes y su meta es lograr agrandar su tienda y establecer mejores condiciones para ésta, ya que atravez de esto quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Margarita es otra integrante del grupo y trabaja en la crianza de cerdos y en la venta de cosméticos. Maritza O. trabaja en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras y Martha T. trabaja en la venta de ropa y cosmenticos.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Las Vecinas [The Neighbors] are composed of 4 good friends that have known each other for over 10 years. They are neighbors that live in the front region of the Tisma municipality.

Blanca Rosa A. is the group coordinator, she is 38 years old, and she is the first shown on the left in the photo. She sells clothing and cosmetics in the Free Trade Zone Tipitapa and in her own house where she has a small shop that still does not have the appropriate conditions in which to run her business.

She would like this loan to invest in what her clients demand; her goal is to expand her shop and improve its conditions, given that through this business she hopes to improve the lives of her children.

Margarita is another group member and she works raising pigs and in the sale of cosmetics. Maritza O. has a business in the purchase and sale of fruits and vegetables, and Martha T. works in the sale of clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to satisfy client demand (clothing and cosmetics).

loans.name: Estelvina De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Estelvina de la Concepción S. de 60 años es una persona muy trabajadora, luchadora y

emprendedora. Ella desde hace ocho años vende pollo crudo y actualmente su negocio ha crecido y tiene mayor 

demanda por lo que requiere de  más inversión en la compra de su materia prima

loans.use: comprar pollo crudo para su negocio

loans.name: Los Alcones Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Alcones está conformado por Henry R. B. de 25 años, el inicio en el negocio del carnicería desde

muy temprana edad con su mamá y actualmente tiene  su propia carnicería en el mercado oriental la cual desea en futuro

no muy lejano ampliarlo.


Los otros integrantes son Noel Gutierrez de 28 años quien es agricultor, este año sembró y cosecho frijoles, arroz, 

maíz y trigo que vendió en el mercado de Masaya. Mientras Francisco Javier P. de 28 años tiene una pequeña 

carnicería en el mercado oriental.
texts.en:
The “Alcones” group was formed by Henry R. B., who is 25-years-old. He began a butcher shop at a very young age with his mother and now has his own butcher shop in the Oriental Market which he wants to expand in the not-too-distant future. The other members of the group are Noel Gutierrez, 28, and Francisco Javier P., 28. Noel is a farmer and this year he planted and harvested beans, rice, corn, and wheat and sold it at a market in Masaya. Francisco Javier has a small butcher shop in the Oriental Market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beef and seeds for planting

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario las divinas es originario de la ciudad de Masaya de el  barrio la reforma ubicado a pocas calles del mercado de central. Está formado por Luisa del Socorro P. M., Francisca del Carmen M. y Petrona P..
Luisa P. trabaja en la compra venta de verduras en el mercado de Masaya, es un negocio muy común, puesto que Masaya y sus municipios se destacan por el alto nivel de productividad en sus tierras.

Agradece a ADIM puesto que le han ayudado con la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por tanto con el mantenimiento de su familia. Su principal meta es crecer a tal punto que no sea ella quien venda en el mercado si no ser quien le proporcione los productos a los mercaderes.

Francisca también trabaja en este tipo de negocio al igual que Luisa y Petrona elabora Nacatamales (Plato típico hecho a base de masa de maíz, cerdo y otros condimentos).

loans.use: Incrementar su negocio

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells sarongs. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She has been in this business for years. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell and make more profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells foodstuffs and phone rechargeable cards and she has been in this business for years. Esther hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and phone rechargeable cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and phone rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 40 years old. Anita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:

To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Chona is just starting this business.

In 2009, Chona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Chona from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.
