loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita T. is a 52-year-old widow from the village of Punta Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, with five children. As a single parent, she must act as both mother and father to them even if they have all reached the age of majority. One of her children already has a family, while the remaining four are still single. Three of her single children are gainfully employed; the youngest, who is 21, is still in school.

Ramonita is glad that she has her own business because she was not left penniless when her husband died. She continued to earn an income that was able to support her family's needs. Ramonita started her general store 11 years ago and it has provided her with enough income to pay for her family's expenses and her children's tuition fees. She has always relied on the loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon to provide her with the necessary revolving working capital that allowed her to continuously stock her store with the necessary volume of inventory.  It currently earns her an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos.  

Her last loan of PHP 13,000, her 11th from NWTF-Project Dungganon, was used to buy stock for her general store. As was her usual practice, she paid each weekly installment on time and was able to fully repay the loan within the loan term, as she promised. Now for her 12th loan cycle, she is proposing to borrow PHP 15,000 to be used again as working capital in her general store so that she can continue earning enough to support her family. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Felicisimo

texts.en:
Felicisimo T.'s main source of income comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in his community. He is 58 years old, widowed and has four adult children. He is from the village of Biasong. Felicisimo has been in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Felicisimo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Felicisimo is requesting a loan of 6000 pesos which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be Felicisimo's first loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 6 meses tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera necesidad y actualmente es la más concurrida de su localidad. Este negocio es una gran oportunidad para incrementar sus ingresos económicos, además que no descuida la atención de sus hijos. Su trato amable y los precios cómodos que ofrece le garantizan el retorno de sus clientes. Para el futuro de su negocio, Blanca desea adquirir vitrinas para que pueda exhibir más mercadería, tanto de comestibles como artículos para el hogar.
Esta es la doceava oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy comprometida y perseverante en su banco comunal y también fue parte de junta directiva. Ahora desea continuar con el mismo ánimo de realizar un trabajo responsable con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado para adquirir más productos como fideos, azúcar , arroz entre otros, los cuales son de mayor demanda en su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 46 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de productos comestibles de primera necesidad y golosinas. Cuando empezó vendía en una caseta (kiosko), pero ahora lo hace desde  su casa, en un espacio que implementó especialmente para su tienda, lo que le permite mayor comodidad. Su esposo (es quien aparece en la foto) y sus hijos, también aportan significativamente en la atención, ya que es un negocio familiar. La ventaja que poseen es que están ubicados muy cerca a un paradero de transporte público, por lo que los choferes son sus principales clientes. Para el futuro, Celia desea vender más y ampliar la mercadería de su tienda.
Este es su crédito número 16 con MFP, ella es una integrante muy activa de su banco comunal y enseña a sus compañeros con ejemplo de puntualidad y un coordinado trabajo en grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en compra de cajas de bebidas gaseosas y mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda M. is a 65-year-old married woman who strives to provide her family with a better life, ensuring that they are free from poverty. She is married to Eduardo M., who worked as a laborer in a sugarcane plantation. They have eight children: six of them already have their own families and only two still live at home. The family lives in the village of Brgy. San Juan, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.

Before she went into business, Erlinda also worked in the sugarcane plantation with her husband so that they could earn enough to feed their family of ten. But working in the sugarcane fields is very hard work, with long hours for very low wages and few benefits, and it took her away from home leaving her children to fend for themselves. Watching her children grow, Erlinda thought about their future and realized that if the family did not earn more income, she and her husband could never afford to send the children to school and provide them with a better future. This is why she decided to put up a small general store next to her house, using some of her salary from the sugarcane plantation. However, because her capital was very limited, she could only sell a few products.

To access more capital, Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, and she immediately saw the impact of the additional 3,000 pesos she received from her first loan. She was able to buy more goods to sell and she noticed that the inventory turnover was faster, and she was able to earn more profits. So, as her income improved and NWTF-Project Dungganon allowed her to borrow larger amounts based on the cash flow estimates she presented in her proposal, she was able to expand her general store.

Her previous loan of 15,000 pesos was her twelfth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was able to pay off each weekly installment on time, and fully repaid the loan within the loan term. It earned her an average monthly income of 3,000 pesos. For her thirteenth loan cycle, she is asking to borrow another 15,000 pesos to use as working capital for her general store so that she can continue improving the life of her family.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy tiene 40 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de pollos, por lo que implementó un espacio en su casa para la crianza de estos animales, los cuales vende los fines de semana. Adicionalmente y de lunes a viernes, vende productos de belleza entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos. Con estos negocios, Edy se genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia y para el futuro desea incrementar sus ventas y también empezar a vender prendas de vestir. 
Esta es la 14va vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante estos años (aproximadamente 7) ha demostrado  ser muy puntual en sus cuotas y es muy estimada por los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la adquisición de más cosméticos y mayor cantidad de pollos pequeños para criarlos en su casa.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fina

texts.es:
Fina tiene 38 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en L. casa D. sus padres. DesD. hace 11 años se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. panes, para lo cual se levanta D. madrugada para que una vez que salgan del horno los distribuya a las diferentes tiendas y bodegas D. su comunidad. Es por ello que día a día se esfuerza para producir mayor cantidad D. panes y que sean del gusto D. las personas, para ello contrata a una persona especialista en L. elaboración D. panes, mientras que Fina supervisa todo el proceso. Su deseo a futuro es implementar su taller D. panificación con maquinaria moderna, ya que actualmente L. preparación es D. manera artesanal.   
Esta es L. sexta oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en L. compra D.  los ingredientes necesarios para L. preparación D. los panes, como harina, levadura y manteca.
texts.en:
Fina, 38, lives with her three children in her parents’ house. For 11 years she has been making and selling bread. To do so she gets up a dawn so that once they come out of the oven she can distribute them to different stores and mini markets in her community. That is why she works so hard day to day to produce a larger quantity of bread that people will like. To do that she hires a specialist in making bread while Fina supervises the whole process. Her wish for the future is to set up a bread making shop with modern equipment. Currently the preparation is by hand. This is her sixth opportunity to have a loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her communal bank. She promises, once again, to be punctual in her payments. The money she is asking for is to buy ingredients she needs to make bread like flour, leavening, and shortening.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 64 años, vive al lado de su esposa y con el menor de sus hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero debido al paso de los años sus fuerzas no son las mismas que en su juventud; por ello, decidió junto a su esposa dedicarse a una actividad que requiera de menos esfuerzo físico, la cual es el bordado de fustanes (faldas). Juan disfruta mucho de trabajar al lado de su esposa (quien aparece en la foto), pues juntos bordan las prendas necesarias para generan los ingresos económicos que  necesitan, tanto para el hogar, como para los estudios del menor de sus hijos. Juan está muy agradecido a la vida por lo que le ha otorgado y su deseo es seguir trabajando al lado de su esposa. 
Es la quinta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está convencido de que ser parte de un banco comunal es muy positivo, pues aparte de aprender a manejar su dinero, es espacio de amistad y confraternidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales que utiliza para elaborar los bordados, tales como hilos de diversos colores y telas.
texts.en:
Juan is 64 years old and lives with his wife and the youngest of his children in his own house. All his life, he has worked in agriculture, but because of his age, his efforts aren’t the same as they were in his youth. Because of this, he decided, with his wife, to pursue the embroidery of skirts, which requires less physical effort. Juan really enjoys working with his wife (who is in the photo). Together, they embroider the garments to earn the income that they need for their household and for the education of their youngest child. Juan is very thankful for what life has granted him, and he wants to continue working with his wife. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he is convinced that being part of a community bank is very positive. Aside from learning how to manage his money, the community bank is a space of friendship and brotherhood. The money he is now requesting will be invested in the purchase of the materials that are used to make the embroidery, including different colors of threads and fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es:
Katerine es una joven de 19 años que vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a realizar diversos oficios en aras de su independencia económica. Principalmente brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en la camioneta que le cedieran sus padres. De lunes a viernes administra los ingresos económicos de este negocio, ella misma es quien cobra los pasajes y contrató a un chofer para conducir la camioneta. Por otro lado; los fines de semana, viaja a otra ciudad, donde viven sus padres para dictar clases particulares de matemática, ya que es estudiante universitaria de pedagogía en matemática. Estas actividades le han permitido a Katerine mejorar su economía y lo que más desea es seguir trabajando con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es un ejemplo de perseverancia para sus compañeros de banco comunal, pues a pesar de su juventud trabaja para forjarse un futuro mejor, sin depender de otras personas. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en el pago del mantenimiento de su camioneta y en la compra de repuestos para ésta.

loans.use: Reparación y mantenimiento de su camioneta

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 56 años, vive con su hijo de 18 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de animales como cuyes y pollos. Para esto, diariamente se dirige a las distintas ferias comerciales de los pueblos aledaños a su localidad para ofrecer sus animales y los fines de semana, en las ferias ganaderas. Maria compra estos animales de una granja, pero también tiene una cantidad que ella misma cría. Este negocio le ha permitido educar a su hijo y sostener los gastos que se requiere su hogar, aun a pesar de las temporadas de ventas bajas, pues su capacidad para el comercio le ha permitido concretar las ventas necesarias para cubrir sus gastos. Para el futuro, Maria desea empezar a vender animales más grandes, como vacas y ovejas.
Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que está comprometida en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando será para invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de cuyes y pollos.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives with her son, who is 18 years old, in her own house. For 20 years, she has done agricultural work and sold animals, like guinea pigs and chickens. For this, every day she goes to different commercial fairs in towns near her area to sell her animals. During the weekends, she sells her animals in the cattle fairs. Maria buys these animals from a farm, but she also has some animals that she raises. This business has allowed her to educate her son and to pay for the household expenses, in spite of seasons of low sales. Her capacity for trade has allowed her to make the necessary sales to cover her expenses. For the future, Maria wants to begin selling larger animals, like cows and sheep. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She feels very happy to be part of her community bank. She is dedicated to being punctual with the repayments of her loan. The money that she is requesting will be used to invest in the purchase of more guinea pigs and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 9 años se dedica al comercio, pero hace un año decidió incursionar en L. venta D. ganado ovino. ElL. compra estos animales en los establos más lejanos D. L. zona rural D. su localidad, pues allí los obtiene a menor precio, posteriormente los revenD., los fines D. semana, en L. feria ganadera D. su ciudad. Los demás días D. L. semana, Marisol se dedica a L. venta D. comida en L. esquina D. su casa o en L. feria D. peleas D. gallos que  hay en su zona. Durante este tiempo D. trabajo ha notado L. rentabilidad D. su negocio, por lo que va a comprar más animales.
Este es su 13avo préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal, pues les tiene gran estima a todos sus compañeros, por lo que asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. junta directiva, durante este ciclo D. crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado al incremento D. los animales que venD..

loans.use: Compra de más ovejas

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir y a quienes trata de brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Su puesto está ubicado en una de las galerías más concurridas de la localidad donde vive, allí vende ropa y vestidos de gala para los diversos eventos sociales y ahora que estamos a puertas de terminar el año la demanda se incrementa, debido a las fiestas de graduación y celebraciones por fin de año, para lo cual se viene preparando. Lo que más le gusta a Dalia de su trabajo es embellecer a las personas con los vestidos de noche, pues son los más elegantes y para complementar su trabajo, también maquilla a sus clientas como una estrategia para captar clientela. Para el futuro, Dalia desea ampliar su negocio, pues su interés es abrir un salón de belleza, por lo que está perfeccionando sus conocimientos con cursos de especialización en cosmetología.
Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que con responsabilidad en sus pagos tendrá acceso a seguir solicitando futuros créditos. Con los tres mil soles que ahora requiere podrá adquirir algunas máquinas para instalar su centro de belleza.

loans.use: Compra de máquinas para su nuevo negocio

loans.name: Horlinda

texts.es:
Horlinda tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, vive en su casa propia donde acoge a la familia de sus dos hijos, con quienes comparte momentos agradables junto a sus nietos. Durante todo el día vende deliciosos dulces y golosinas en la puerta de su domicilio, donde instaló un pequeño puesto y donde espera con mucha alegría a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son niños y escolares de su localidad. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es la sonrisa de los niños, quienes la contagian con su buen sentido del humor, ella lleva 27 años vendiendo en su casa y considera que lo difícil es atender su puesto con sus nietos alado, pues no desea que sus pequeños consuman demasiados dulces que perjudiquen su salud. Para el futuro, Horlinda espera ampliar su negocio y tener un local donde pueda vender frutas y bebidas, productos que son muy consumidos en el verano.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sabe que su puntualidad es una de las garantías que la respaldan. Con los tres mil soles solicitados implementará su puesto con nuevos productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 41años, su buen ánimo y la alegría que irradia la distinguen dentro de todas las señoras de su barrio. Vive junto a su pareja y sus hijos, por quienes trabaja con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es la preparación y venta de bocadillos y pasteles, los cuales realiza en su casa y allí también recibe los pedidos de sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, amistades y parientes, quienes para cada evento social acuden confiadamente en ella, pues se caracteriza por ser muy cumplida. Lo que más le gusta a Isabel de su trabajo es la decoración de las tortas, pues pone a prueba su creatividad; sin embargo, en los 7 años trabajando de esta manera, considera que lo difícil es trasladar los pedidos a diversos lugares de la ciudad, pues es muy cansado debido a la distancia que tiene que recorrer. Para el futuro, Isabel espera implementar un espacio en su casa con materiales y utensilios necesarios para incrementar su producción, pues en ocasiones ha tenido que rechazar pedidos.
Este es el primer crédito individual que solicita con Microfinanzas PRISMA, pues los anteriores fueron con su banco comunal, donde siempre ha trabajando puntualmente y le tienen en gran estima. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará los ingredientes de pastelería necesarios e implementará su cocina adecuadamente para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Isabel is 41-year-old woman, and her energy and happiness separate her from all the women in her neighborhood. She lives with her partner and children, for whom she works with the goal of improving her quality of life. Her business is preparing and selling sandwiches and pastries, which she makes in her house. She also receives orders from her clients, the majority of whom are her neighbors, friends and relatives. Her clients trust her for their social events, because she is known to be very gifted. What she likes most about her work is decorating the cakes, because this puts her creativity to the test. However, in the 7 years she has done this work, she considers it difficult to transport the orders to different places in the city, since she gets very tired from the distance she has to travel. In the future, Isabel hopes to implement a space in her house with materials and utensils necessary to increase her production, because at times she has to reject orders. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, but her earlier loans were with her community bank, where she has always worked punctually and where they hold her in great esteem. With the 2500 soles that she is requesting, she will buy necessary pastry ingredients and will implement her kitchen adequately to improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement her kitchen

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su familia, con quienes vive en su pequeña casa. Su anhelo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, lo cual realiza en un espacio que implementó en su casa para su tienda desde hace 5 años. Aquí trabaja arduamente en compañía de su pareja, quien le tiende una mano en los momentos más tediosos. Pero a pesar del estrés de algunos días, Llerme  siempre tiene una gran sonrisa para recibir a sus clientes, quienes están muy contentos por las atenciones que les brindan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las conversaciones que mantiene con sus vecinas, quienes encuentran en ella a una amiga. Sin embargo, lo más difícil es tener que lidiar con la delincuencia que se presenta por su zona, pues los ladrones siempre están al asecho. Para el futuro, Llerme espera incrementar sus ingresos y ampliar su local para ofrecer nuevos productos, además de asegurar su local para evitar sufrir robos.
Este es su primer crédito de manera individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde también forma parte de un banco comunal y es reconocida como una de las socias más alegres y cumplidas con sus pagos. Los dos mil soles solicitados serán invertidos en la compra de productos nuevos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Llerme is 55 years old. She is a woman who is very committed to the development of her family with whom she lives in her small house. Her desire is to improve their living conditions. Her business is selling groceries, which she performs in a space that she created in her house for her store five years ago. Here, she works hard alongside her spouse who lends her a hand in the most tedious moments. However, despite the stress of some days, Llerme always has a big smile when she receives her customers who are very happy for the attention she provides. What she likes the most about her work are the conversations that she has with her neighbors, who see her as a friend. Nevertheless, what is most difficult is to have to deal with the crime in her area since the theives are always waiting in ambush. For the future, Llerme hopes to increase her income and expand her shop in order to offer new products, in addition to make her store more secure to avoid robberies. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA where she also formed part of a community bank and is recognized as one of the members who is happiest and most punctual with payments. The two thousand requested soles will be invested in the purchase of new products with which to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 40 años, es una mujer que trabaja arduamente, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo, quienes son su mayor tesoro. Sus deseos de progresar la motivaron a implementar una tienda de comestibles dentro de su casa, a la que sus vecinos están acostumbrados a visitar. Asimismo, trabaja en el comedor popular de su localidad, el cual tiene 10 años de creado. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede dedicarse a sus dos labores durante el día y percibir algunos ingresos adicionales que le ayuden a mejorar su condición de vida. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender ambas actividades a la vez, pero está muy contenta de mantenerse ocupada, aunque termine muy cansada por la noche. Para el futuro, Reyna espera lograr implementar su bodega con nuevos productos solicitados por sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende su crecimiento económico.
Este es su primer préstamo individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con  la misma responsabilidad que con su banco comunal, donde la consideran una de las socias más cumplidas del grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados espera ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos para sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Zia Khanam Group

texts.en:
This is the two-member Zia Khanam group. Both members would like to improve their businesses. 

Zia Khanam is a carpet weaver. She would like to take a loan to buy materials in order to weave good quality carpets. 

Zainab is a tailor. She would like to take a loan to expand her business and purchase a new sewing machine because she has got lots of problems with her current one. 

They are pleased to be a part of this effective program.

loans.use: To buy materials for weaving good quality carpets

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad A.'s main source of income comes from selling ready-to-wear clothes in her community. She is 57 years old, widowed and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7000 pesos from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding her business, Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Salema Group

texts.en:
Salema is the group leader of the Salema group. This group is made up of four female members.

Salema has a joint tailoring business with her son, which involves sewing different kinds of clothes.

Bebe Khord has a quilt-making business, and she wants to take a loan to buy necessary materials.

Homa wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Hamida would like to take a loan to buy a new engine for her husband's taxi.

They have requested a group loan of 40000 AFN. They would like to say that Kiva offers the best process for supporting people.

loans.use: To purchase materials and expand the business

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly G. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Beverly is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Guadalope

texts.en:
Guadalope B. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Guadalope is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Guadalope owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Guadalope has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Guadalope joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guadalope has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Guadalope is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Guadalope from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana A. is a native of the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and wife to Librado who is 43 years old; he is a fisherman and also a farmer. She is the mother of two daughters.

Juliana's dream is to uplift their living conditions. She wants to give a decent life to her family, especially the children. She is engaged in the fishing business. She has a fish cage where she raises small fish until they grow and are ready for harvest. The business seems to be profitable and sound, and she wants to invest more in it.

In 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with the motivation of having access to capital. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish cage. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase thousands of fingerlings (small fish), 20 pieces bamboo, sacks of fish foods and in payment for labor.

Juliana is optimistic that her business will grow and she can earn more income to save in preparation ofor her children’s future, specially their education fees. She also aspires of having more fish cages in order to produce more fish since that means greater income.

loans.use: To purchase thousands of fingerlings (small fish), 20 pieces bamboo, sacks of fish foods and pay for labor

loans.name: Marysol

texts.en:
Marysol B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Marysol is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marysol owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marysol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marysol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marysol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marysol is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marysol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. lives in an island village in the beautiful town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is determined and optimistic about getting out from the cycle of poverty. She is married to Andres who is 33 and a ferry (small passenger boat in the island) driver. She is the mother to an only daughter, Andrea, who is two years old.

Anita is engaged in the resale of 'kaing' (big fruit baskets) and charcoal. She has been doing the resale business since she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2007. She buys charcoal and 'kaing' from the makers and re-sells it. She says, the business brings her in enough income to augment their standard of living and to sustain their daily needs. She wants to invest more in the business.

Now on her 4th loan, she proposes to borrow 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will fund the purchase of ready-made 'kaing', 50 sacks of charcoal, and payment for labor and transportation expenses. Anita has regular customers already and charcoal is easy to sell because it is commonly used by households in the cooking of foods.

Anita is optimistic that her business will grow and can help her reach her dreams. She aspires to expand her business for greater income. She also dreams of sending her child to school until she finishes college and finds job. She also hopes to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: for the purchase of ready-made 'kaing' baskets, 50 sacks of charcoal and payment for labor and transportation expenses

loans.name: Jamila Group

texts.en:
Jamila is the group leader of the two-member Jamila group. Both members would like to expand their businesses and bring about new changes in their businesses and lives. They have requested a group loan of 20000 AFN.

Jamila wants to take a loan for her laboratory. She wants to complete her requirements.

Najeeba is a tailor and would like to buy a new sewing machine and other supplies that she needs.

They would like to extend their gratitude to Kiva lenders for their support of entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To complete the requirements for her laboratory

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is 45 years old and married to Virgilio, a ferry (small passenger boat) driver, who is 48 years old. She is a mother to three, two sons and a daughter. All of her kids are in school and they are very studious. She lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2007, Norma joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hopes of getting access to capital to fund her business. For more than eight years she has been engaged in the resale of frozen foods as her primary business and fishing as her secondary business. Recently she decided to make fishing her primary business. She believes that fishing, as compared to the resale of frozen foods, brings her much more income for sustaining the needs of her family, especially with all of her kids attending school.

Now on her fourth loan, she is requesting 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her fishing business. Part of the loan money will still go to her resale of frozen foods. Specifically, some of the amount will be used to pay for two bundles of fishnets for her fish cage and some will be used as rolling capital for her frozen foods business.

Norma is positive that her business will succeed with the help of ASHI and with the trust of KIVA lenders. She dreams of supporting her children in their schooling until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for her fish cage and as rolling capital for her frozen foods business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy B. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. She is 34 years old. Lucy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucy owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Lucy has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lucy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna D. is a woman from the island village in the town of Binangonan in Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Librado, who is 50 years old and the driver of a small passenger ferry. She is a mother to three: two sons and a daughter.

She has faith that she will get out of poverty. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of hope of gaining access to capital. Her previous loans were carefully invested in a hog-raising business (pigs). The business runs smoothly, and it brings them good profit during times when the pigs are sold in the market. But it takes more than three months before the pigs will be ready to sell.

Just recently, she decided to shift her business to a more productive business: fishing. She believes that a fishing business would bring her enough profit with less time and effort. Now that she is about to receive her third loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP, she plans to buy 30 pieces of bamboo, thousands of fingerlings and fry, and bundles of fishnet, as well as to pay labor expenses.

She is hopeful that, with the help of ASHI and with the trust of KIVA lenders, little by little, she can reach her dreams in life. She aspires to expand her business and be able to save for the future of her children, especially their school needs.

loans.use: To pay for 30 pieces of bamboo, thousands of fingerlings and fry, and bundles of fishnet, as well as to pay labor expenses

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney started his sheet metal business, C. Sheet Metal, in 2007 after having worked with his uncle for ten years in the same industry.

In a short period of time, Rodney grew his business into a successful enterprise. He considers himself a fighter; he has acquired numerous contracts and has expanded his business despite the downturn in the economy. Today, he needs $10,000 to finance more growth and to purchase inventory.

In the future, Rodney hopes to keep his business growing, with the goal of hiring others to create jobs in his community. After being denied at his bank for a line of credit because of his credit score, he is relieved to know that there are organizations out there that trust his abilities and are willing to give him a chance.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 36 años, es un joven muy trabajador y entregado al cuidado de su madre, con quien vive en su casa, tratando de ofrecerle una vida de calidad. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano con el ánimo de salir a trabajar vendiendo y comprando dólares en el distrito de Miraflores (uno de los distritos más turísticos de Lima), pero lo que le diferencia de los demás cambistas es la alegría con que atiende a las personas y sobre todo la seguridad que les brinda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce personas muy importantes, como dueños o gerentes de empresas que transitan por el lugar, haciéndose conocido entre ellos. En los 15 años que lleva en este negocio considera que lo más difícil es lidiar con los  delincuentes, quienes están al asecho, por ello trata de ser prudente con el dinero que transporta. Para un futuro no muy lejano, Alejandro espera contar con  local seguro y estable donde pueda instalarse y atienda mejor a sus clientes
Este  es su préstamo 18 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, la puntualidad en sus pagos lo ha caracterizado y en su grupo lo reconocen como una persona íntegra y leal. Con los dos mil soles que viene solicitando aumentará su capital de trabajo y así tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 36 years old, and a very hardworking young man, who is involved in the care of his mother. She lives in his home and he tries to provide her with a quality life. Everyday he rises very early with a will to go out and work, buying and selling dollars in the Miraflores district (one of the major tourist districts of Lima). But what differentiates him from the other exchangers is the joy with which he attends to people and, above all, the security he offers them.

In the 15 years he has been in this business he considers the most difficult aspect to be dealing with delinquents who lie in wait for him. For this reason, he tries to be prudent with the money he carries. In the near future, Alejandro hopes to have a safe and stable location where he can install himself and better attend to his customers.

This is his 18th loan with PRISMA Microfinance. Alejandro's payments have always been punctual and in his group he is recognized as a person of integrity and loyalty. This $700 will augment his working capital and thereby offer the possibility of increasing his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE HIS WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 68 años, es una dulce mujer entregada a su trabajo, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo, con quien comparte todas sus alegrías y triunfos. Tiene un pequeño restaurante ubicado en el parque de su localidad, para este negocio cuenta con una socia, quien es una amiga con la que trabaja arduamente. Desde las 10 de la mañana inicia su actividad preparando los más deliciosos platillos, sobre todo los más solicitados por sus clientes, quienes diariamente se reúnen en el local de doña Catalina y ella los recibe con una gran sonrisa, pues sabe que gracias a ellos su negocio va mejorando. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es compartir sus actividades junto a su amiga, quien le ayuda en la atención a los clientes haciéndose menos pesado el trabajo. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 11 años y considera que lo más difícil es atender a sus comensales durante el medio día, pues la demanda es mayor. Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su restaurante y ambientarlo con muebles que den mayor comodidad a sus clientes.  
Este es su préstamo 18 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde su responsabilidad y compromiso la caracterizan en su banco comunal, donde todas sus compañeras la respetan como líder del grupo. Con los dos mil soles que ahora solicita comprará algunos utensilios de cocina que le hace falta para una mejor atención en su restaurante.

loans.use: Compra de utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 24 años, es una joven muy optimista, vive con su madre a quien trata de apoyar con los gastos de la casa, pues su mayor deseo es mantener el bienestar de su hogar. Su interés por los cosméticos la llevó a emprender su trabajo como vendedora de productos de belleza. Ahora trabaja ofreciendo a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos diversos catálogos de muestra, pero lo que les agrada a sus clientes es el trato que reciben y la bonita personalidad de Jackeline. Lo que a ella más le gusta de su negocio son los premios que recibe de las diversas líneas de belleza por el incremento de sus ventas. Lleva 5 años en este rubro y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los cobros a las personas que se retrasan en sus pagos. Para el futuro, Jackeline desea instalar en su domicilio un stand con los productos de belleza que tiene en stock, lo cual le permitirá tener ingresos diarios, sin tener que esperar la entrega de los pedidos cada fin de mes.
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y es consciente que su permanencia en la institución tendrá que ver con la puntualidad en sus cuotas de pago. Con los dos mil soles solicitados realizará mayor cantidad de pedidos y tendrá la posibilidad de acceder a las ofertas que brindan las líneas de belleza.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años, es un hombre trabajador y entusiasta, pues siempre ánima a su familia a perseverar para lograr sus metas. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. La actividad que realiza es la carpintería, negocio que lo acompaña desde hace 10 años. En sus inicios tuvo muchos problemas para instalar su taller y tuvo que trabajar en diversas empresas para conseguir el dinero suficiente para comprar su maquinaria, con el tiempo logró instalar su taller dentro de su casa y ahora es el carpintero más reconocido de su localidad, pues los trabajos que realiza tienen un acabado de calidad. Lo que más le agrada a Juan de su trabajo es barnizar los muebles, pues así obtienen una belleza especial; por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil de su labor es realizar los muebles grandes para salas, pues beben tener acabados perfectos, pero también son muy rentables porque el costo de producción se incrementa por el tiempo invertido. Para futuro, Juan desea ampliar su taller y adquirir nueva maquinaria que le permita agilizar su trabajo.
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y tiene todo el ánimo de trabajar responsablemente con cumpliendo de sus cuotas de pago. Con los mil seiscientos soles que viene solicitando comprará algunas herramientas para trabajar con madera con mayor exactitud.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old. He is an enthusiastic and industrious man, and therefore always encouraging his family to preserve to achieve their goals. He lives in his own house with his wife and his three small children. He has worked as a carpenter for ten years. In the beginning he had many problems installing his workshop and had to work in diverse business to obtain sufficient money to buy his machinery. With time he managed to install a workshop inside their house and is now the most recognized carpenter in the region, because his works are of the highest quality. What pleases Juan most about his work is varnishing the furniture, which causes the furniture to obtain a special beauty. On the other hand, he considers the most difficult part of his work making large furniture for rooms because they have to be finished perfectly, however large furniture is also very profitable because the cost of production is increased for the time invested. In the future, Juan desires to expand its workshop and to acquire new machinery that will permit him to expedite his work. This is his first credit with Microfinanzas PRISM, an affiliate of Kiva, and he intends to work responsibly and comply with his payments. With the 1600 soles that he is requesting, he will buy tools to work with wood with greater accuracy.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy woodworking tools

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una carismática mujer de 36 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos: Esteban de 11 y Katherin de 10 años, hace pocas semanas nació el bebé que esperaba, así que está muy contenta. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la preparación y venta de jugos de fruta, pero al haber quedado embarazada y con el reposo recomendado por los médicos, tuvo que dejar de lado esta actividad, dedicándose por completo a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que no requiere mucho esfuerzo, además sus clientas van hasta su casa a ver las novedades que ella ofrece en los catálogos que tiene de reconocidas empresas de cosméticos. Juana quiere ofrecerle lo mejor a su recién nacida, es por ello que piensa seguir trabajando sin descuidarla. 
Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un grupo solidario y se lleva muy bien con sus compañeras, además que todas son muy puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, pues quiere aumentar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos económicos para su hogar.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una amistosa mujer de 37 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos por temporada, los cuales varía según la estación. Actualmente, al ingresar en la estación más alegre del año, la primavera, se encuentra vendiendo ropa, actividad que le toma todo el día, ya que lo hace visitando las casas de sus vecinas y amigas, quienes le solicitan las prendas. A Judith le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es muy independiente y siempre puede darse tiempo para no descuidar su hogar en las labores cotidianas, además de pasar tiempo con sus hijos. Ella espera trabajar a favor de ellos y en un futuro llegar a tener un negocio muy rentable, ha pensado que podría tratarse de una tienda, un bazar o tienda de ropa, las posibilidades son muchas y muy variadas, pero ella piensa que aún tiene tiempo para lograr cumplir todos sus sueños, sólo necesita ponerle muchas ganas y empeño.
Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y el trabajo en su grupo es muy bueno, ya que sus compañeras son muy unidas y divertidas. Ella invertirá el dinero que viene solicitando en la compra de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, además de abastecerse con novedades en ropa para lograr mejores ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 28 años y vive al lado de su esposo y su pequeña hija, la cual lamentablemente sufre de un mal al corazón. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en compañía de su esposo, ambos trabajan día a día para brindarle a su hija una buena calidad de vida. Pero algunas veces, la pequeña sufre de recaídas, por lo cual deben ir frecuentemente al medico, es por ello que María usualmente no permanece en su puesto de venta, dejándole las riendas a su esposo (quien aparece en la foto), quien sabe administrar muy bien el negocio en su ausencia. A ambos les gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que les permite ser independientes y lograr generar sus propios ingresos económicos. Para el futuro esperan tener un local adecuado con el que puedan aumentar sus ingresos para darle a su pequeña esperanzas de un futuro mejor.
Es su quinto préstamo con MFP, María es muy puntual en sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de su grupo, quienes son también muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más pescado para aumentar sus ventas y por ende generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 28, is a hard-working lady, who lives with her husband and small daughter, who unfortunately suffers from a heart defect. María works selling fish with her husband and they both work day by day to offer their daughter a good quality of life. However, sometimes their little daughter suffers relapses so they must frequently go to the doctor. Because of this, María usually can't stay in her post at the shop, leaving her husband (who appears in the photo) in charge. He knows how to manage the business very well in her absence. They both enjoy their work, which enables them to be independent and generate their own financial income. In the future, they hope to have a suitable place to increase their income to give their daughter hope for a better future.

This is María's fifth loan with MFP and she is very punctual with her payments, as are the other members of her group, who are also very responsible. With the money requested, she will buy mO. fish to increase their sales and thereby generate mO. income.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo Martín de 41, él es estibador, tiene 3 hijos: Jonatan de 16, Marcia de 15 y Samir de 4 años de edad, todos viven muy contentos en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le gusta mucho, ya que le brinda independencia y libertad en su economía, pues así no sólo depende del sueldo de su esposo y puede desempeñarlo en los momentos en que dispone de tiempo sin descuidar su hogar. Además los ingresos que logra son muy rentables y María tiene la esperanza de hacerlo crecer mucho más. Para el futuro quiere tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer de manera más cómoda su mercadería, ya que actualmente debe visitar casa por casa a sus clientas, resultándole muy cansado el recorrido, pero felizmente tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y sabe que cumplirá sus sueños. Es el sétimo préstamo de María con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, además el trabajo con su grupo es muy bueno, ya que todas son buenas amigas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para tenerla en stock y venderla de forma inmediata, sin esperar los pedidos por catálogo.
texts.en:
María, 37, lives with her husband, Martín, 41, a docker, and has three children: Jonatan, 16, Marcia, 15, and Samir, 4. They live together happily in their own house. For the past 8 years, María has been working in the sale of beauty products, an activity that she likes a lot and that offers her independence and freedom with her finances. In which case, she doesn't have to depend solely on her husband's salary and can carry out her activities when she has available time without neglecting her home life. Besides, the income she makes is very profitable and María hopes to grow the business much more. In the future, she would like to have a shop where she could offer her merchandise more conveniently, as she currently has to visit her clients' houses, house by house, and the travel makes her very tired. But she is keen to succeed and knows that she will achieve her dreams. This is María's seventh loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with repayments, beside she enjoys working with the group as they are all good friends. With the money requested, María will buy a greater quantity of merchandise to keep in stock and sell immediately, without having to wait for orders from catalogues.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 49 años, es natural D. Iquitos (región D. selva peruana), siendo muy alegre y carismática. Vive con sus 3 hijos: Jimy D. 30, Piero D. 23 y Miluska D. 17 años, en su casa propia. Anteriormente tenía una tienda D. comestibles, pero como en ese entonces sus hijos eran pequeños, se comían parte D. la mercadería, ocasionando algunos desbarajustes económicos. Entonces Zolia vio por conveniente cambiar D. rubro y es así que hace 4 años implementó en su casa una ferretería, actividad que viene realizando con gran alegría, ya que los ingresos son muy buenos. A Zoila le agrada mucho su trabajo, ya que la hace sentirse independiente y además le da la tranquilidad necesaria y en algunas ocasiones la ayudan en la atención su nuera o su hija, haciendo más liviano su trabajo, aunque muchas veces la mercadería pesa mucho y necesita ser transportada D. un lugar a otro, es cuando se le complica el trabajo, pero felizmente también sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad, ella sabe que todos juntos saldrán adelante y es por ello que le pone muchas ganas a su trabajo.  
Es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas Prisma y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para abastecer su ferretería con los artículos que piden sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Efosa

texts.en: Efosa is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells phone recharge cards and phone accessories and has been in the business for the past 3 years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N 50, 000 to purchase more phone recharge cards and phone accessories to sell. He says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She is requesting for the loan amount of N 80, 000 to purchase more foodstuff and drinks. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and drinks

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in this fire wood business for the past 3 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 80, 000 to purchase more fire wood to sell. Benita says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more fire wood to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells foodstuff. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in the business for the past 8years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N 90, 000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells fairly used clothes. She lives in Benin City and has been in this business for the past 10years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N 80, 000 to purchase more fairly used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She sells baking items and has been in the business for the past 2 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100, 000 to purchase more baking items to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to sell

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle E. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Rochelle is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rochelle owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a nipa hut making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling nipa hut to local businesses and community members. Rochelle has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rochelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rochelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rochelle is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rochelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe L. lives in Poblacion, Sindangan. She was married to a layman and blessed with three (3) children. She operates a small grocery store in their community which largely sells primary commodities. Her business was started last 1998 and serves them well as one of their source of livelihood.

She started her membership last October 9, 2007. She has proved to be a good member in the institution since her membership. Recently, she is enjoying her fourth cycle loan.

She is looking forward that she can improve her economic status as she invests more capital in her business.

loans.use: Additional capital on sari-sari.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Minda is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Minda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Minda is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Minda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
A young and active entrepreneur is Mrs. Richie A., 24 years old and a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, a zone within Tangub City on the island of Mindanao. She is blessed with one minor child. Her husband, Samuel, drives a motorcycle for hire, which is locally known as a Jabal-jabal. On average, he earns at least 150 PHP a day.

Richie wants to help her husband. She decided to start a wholesale RTW clothes, jewelry and powdered milk business one year ago with her neighbors and friends as her first customers. She is now earning an average net income of 3,000 PHP a month.

Richie is a new member of Nangka Center under the PDP-LP program of Paglaum MPC (PMPC). She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP for her business. She hopes that someday she will have her own boutique.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional capital for her wholesale RTW clothes, jewelry and powdered milk business

location.town: P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Mrs. Teresita O., 45 years of age, married is a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer and works also as a carpenter for added income. With this condition, Mrs. O. decided to engage in business to help her husband in supporting their family. She opened up a sari-sari store 5 years ago. Now she is earning an average net income of  3,000 Php per month. As a 4th cycle loaner of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, she is applying an amount of 10,000 Php to add her capital on her existing sari-sari store business. She is very thankful to PAGLAUM MPC because of the continued learning education given by the staff to its members.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store business

location.town: P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Marpie

texts.en: Our featured micro-entrepreneur is Mrs. Marpie F., 37 years of age, married to Gregorio F., is a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. They are blessed with 3 children but only one is her dependent with age of 4 years. For their living, her husband is a caretaker of a farm with a monthly wage of 5,000 Php and some allowances. But this amount is not sufficient to meet their needs and this is the reason why Mrs. F. decided to engage in different businesses. At present, she has a little sari-sari store inside her house. She is also a member of JTY, a direct selling company for RTW’s and also a retailing activity for dried fish. As a new member of PAGLAUM MPC this month, she is applying an amount of 5,000 Php to add her capital and additional amount to build a proper stall for her store. Her wish in life is to be able to support her son up to college.

loans.use: Additonal capital for business and part to be used for building a stall for her store

loans.name: Saom's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by two borrowers. Its leader, Mrs. V., 39, has a job cultivating a rice crop for a profit, while her husband works with her on the farm. This family now lives with their four teenage children, all of whom are attending school.

V. will be using her first loan from Kiva to buy rice in bulk to store as her stock supply during the coming harvesting season and then she will sell it when the rice is commanding its highest prices. This will provide her family with extra income.

The other borrower, Mrs. S., 38, sells grocery item from home, and is asking for a loan to purchase a quantity of her essential items to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah - Negara. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent, or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tunas Mekar Asih (DNR.M-0595).

Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini owns & operates a business that raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 300.000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living situation and be able to engage in expanded business activities. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is requesting a loan in the amount of 1.000.000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ni Ketut Tiyarmini from DINARI. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Tiyarmini - (-) merupakan 34 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah - Negara.  Ni Ketut Tiyarmini adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Tunas Mekar Asih (DNR.M-0595).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut Tiyarmini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR.  Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut Tiyarmini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.000.000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

texts.en:
Juvy D. is from the village of Binone, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Juvy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Elvira is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $25 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Mrs. Eim Hin Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people and they all live in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. Mrs. Eim H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a chicken breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens, chicken foods, and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Douk Soeun, owns a horse to use with a cart to transport the goods and passengers. Mrs. Eim H. is 32 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. 

Five members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more chickens, chicken foods, and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets for breeding.

Isidora E. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 63 years old. Isidora is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Isidora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Isidora has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $112 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Isidora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Isidora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.
