loans.name: Mich's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers. Mr. S., 29, has been selected to be a leader by the group member. S. currently teaches the local student for a public school in the village. As another source of family income is from his wife’s decorating business. She is also hired by people to decorate and make up their house when they have a wedding party. S. is skill in teaching to his student through computer system, but he doesn’t own his computer for using purposes, so that he would like a Kiva loan to buy a used computer to support his teaching. The other two borrowers are:
S., 34, is a grocery seller, who asking for a loan to increase to essential items to sell.
S. will be using her loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow.

loans.use: To buy a used computer to support his teaching

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou L., 29, is married with a three-year-old child. To make a living, she has been in the city to work as a garment factory worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is involved in the agriculture sector, and he is also a construction worker in his province, earning an income of US $5 per day. Their living standard is improved since they have had these businesses. Therefore, Eng is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport his rice production to sell. By doing so, she hopes her husband will be able to generate more income to raise a good standard of living for the family.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is from the city of Kalasan,Pagadian City. She is 40 years old. Helen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun K., 59, is a widow and resides in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of manufacturing fabric for washing mirrors, earning US $6.6 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed in a hotel in the city, earning US $2.6 per day. She plans to take a loan of US $500 to purchase more fabric to produce more outputs to generate more income to raise a good standard of living of the family.

loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Um

texts.en: S. is 48 years old and a resident of Kampong, Chhnang Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of nine children. Four are single and five are married and live away from home. She is married to Mr. Ourt, age 46, who is also a rice farmer and a fisherman. To help meet with her family's expenses, one of her sons is driving a motor taxi. S. will be using her first loan to buy more fishing tools for her husband's fishing operations.

loans.use: To buy more fish tools for her husband's fishing operations.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk S., 39, is married with four children and resides in Takeo province. To make a living, she is involved in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer on her plot of farmland, earning approximately US $1 per day. Her husband operates his motor-taxi in the city at some crowded places, earning an income of US $4 per day as the primary source of income of the family. To make a better standard of living, she is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business because the old motorbike consumes a lot of gasoline and becomes broken very often.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Meang

texts.en: Meang R., 48, is married with 4 children. He operates his motor taxi in the city, earning an income of US $5 per day which is the primary source of income for the family.  His wife stays at home and involved in the agriculture sector of raising pigs, earning an income of US $2 per day. The family is also assisted by two of his children who are currently employed in a local garment factory with an income of US $2 each per day. To make a better living standard, he is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase pigs and animal food to improve his wife’s business at home. He hopes that he will be able to make those pigs grow efficiently and sell them for good prices at the market.

loans.use: buy pigs and animal food

loans.name: Mrs. Chean Tum Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chean T. is a group leader of six members who all live in ThU. village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to her crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Men Rorn, is a hard working man who has been hired by the other villager to work on the filed. Mrs. Chean T. is 30 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled I the local school and the others are just five and one years old. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov C., 36, is married with three school-aged children and resides in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of manufacturing soy milk in her village, earning an income of US $8 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. Her husband operates his motor-taxi at the market, earning US $4 per day. To make a better standard of living, C. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a new motorbike to improve her husband’s business and to attach the expected motorbike with a water container to transport water in order to sell it in the village.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is a woman of determination and has faith that she can escape poverty. She is a native of the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Elmer who is 49 years old. She is a mother to three, a daughter and two sons.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. She decided to join ASHI because she needed working capital for her dying business of selling ready-to-wear clothes. When she received her previous loans, she carefully invested the money in her resale business. She now has regular customers and her business brings her enough income to provide for the needs of her family. She dreams of making her business grow, and she wants to invest more in this business.

Now on her third loan, Julieta is requesting an amount of 15,000 PHP as additional capital to pay for a variety of clothing to sell. She is positive that her business will grow now that she has the support of ASHI and the trust of KIVA lenders.

She dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also hopes to renovate her house from the proceeds of her business.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi F. is 56 years old and a farmer, supplying rice in her village. She has six children, who are all married. What keeps her busy everyday is her five-hectare rice field, which she hopes can provide her family an income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs.

Noemi would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva field partner. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities that will increase her harvest. 

She is glad to join the CEVI micro-credit program because it has the lowest interest rate which she thinks is very affordable and easy to repay.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn F. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Evelyn is just starting this business.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita O. is from the town of Pob. Guipos, Zambo.Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Lolita is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: This small loan is being requested by two borrowers. Mrs. Chork S., 47, has been selected to be the leader by the other group member. Chork currently sells little sweet cakes to her neighbors in the village. She is a widowed mother who has four children. She is looking for a loan to order rice in bulk from rice farmers which she will then sell to gain more income. The other member of the group, Mrs. T., will be using part of the loan to support her business of selling vegetables.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz G., who is 38 years old, is a rice grower from Norala, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has two children, the eldest being 10 years old. They inspire her to work hard for her family. Currently, she tills a one-hectare farm that she hopes will provide her family enough income to buy their basic needs.

Luz is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities. The loan is truly helpful since she doesn't have ready cash to support her business now.

loans.use: Farm Finanicng

loans.name: Emely

To make a living, Emely owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling specialty food products in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Emely is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

To make a living, Mary Ann S owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Mary Ann S has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Mary Ann S is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Ann S from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: S., 47, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. S. is married with three children, while her husband works on the farm. S. applies for a loan to purchase more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas A. owns and manages a small rice field. She has been supplying rice to some rice traders and is able to earn enough cash for her family needs like food, clothing and school fees. She has seven children and her eldest child is already 24.

Leonidas has been worrying about the growing expenses they have in their home. Hopefully, her rice farm business will also be able to help pay for the books, tuition and other school expenses.

Leonidas is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities to grow her harvest.

Leonidas has been a client of CEVI for quite a long time now. Her participation in CEVI has helped her sustain her farming livelihood and she has also started to raise forty ducks.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Chourng

texts.en:
Chourng N., 55, is a widow and resides with one of her children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is involved in the business of purchasing silk from people who produce silk in her village and other nearby places, earning US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently working in a local garment factory with an income of US $3 per day.

Chourng N. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more silk to resell for more income. In the photo, she is happily preparing Cambodian traditional cakes during the biggest religious ceremoN. in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel De Jesus M. R., tiene 46 años de edad vive en Mejicanos municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Vive solo con sus dos hijas Verónica de 11 años y Ana de 8 años, Manuel es un hombre de familia con mucha responsabilidad, ya que es él, el único proveedor para la familia. Posee su propio negocio una venta de relojes de brazalete, calculadoras, gorras, cinchos y otros. El crédito que solicta Manuel es para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Mezyl

texts.en: Mezyl G. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mezyl owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mezyl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mezyl is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto A. G. reside en San Salvador. Vive solamente con su mamá la Sra. Elsa de 84 años de edad. Mario es buen hijo, se ha quedado al cuido de su madre quien ha sido olvidada por todos sus hijos pero con el apoyo y cariño de Mario es feliz. Mario cuida de su madre con los ingresos que percibe de su  negocio una tienda de productos de consumo, El crédito es para surtir su tienda con sopas, gaseosas, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto A. G. lives in San Salvador with his 84 year old mother, Elsa. He is a good son. Mario was left to care for his mother because she had been forgotten by her other children. She remains happy thanks to his love and support.

Mario is able to provide for his mother out of his earnings selling consumer products from his grocery business. He will use his loan to restock his store with soaps, sodas, basic grains, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros A. is from the village of Barangay Dos. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Milagros owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years with approximate average monthly earnings of 4,000 PHP. In 2006, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi

loans.use: Reparacion de infraestructura en el molino

loans.name: Nelly Lisseth

texts.es: Nelly Lisseth R. C. de 28 años de edad, reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador, vive con  su esposo y su hija Rebeca de un año de edad, Nelly es de gran apoyo a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ha instalado un comedor desde su casa para cuidar de su hija y poder trabajar, es así como funciona el comedor de Nelly día a día. El destino del crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para aumentar su producción

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S., 62 years old is a supplier of rice in their own village. She has a 1 and 3/4 hectare farm which she expects could prtovide her family an income to buy foods and other needs. From her experiences, she noticed that her farm is gaining always and she wanted to gain more from it buy to be able to supply more rice to her regular customers. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farm by buying the faming necesities to grow her harvest. In that way, she will be able to earn more and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. has a business of her own. She is 37 years old and married to Jonjie, who is 34 years old and a fisherman. She is a mother to five: two sons and three daughters. She lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, in Rizal province in the Philippines. She believes that to get out of the cycle of poverty, people should exert effort in looking for sustainable ways of living.

With her desire to overcome poverty, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009, with a bagful of hope of gaining access to capital for her dying business. When she received her first loan, she carefully invested it as additional capital in her fishing business. She has fish cages where small fish are cultured until they are ready to harvest.

Now on her 2nd loan, she wants to invest more in the fishing business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for fish nets, ropes, bamboo, and labor in making fish cages. She is positive that her business will grow and could bring her enough income to save for her children's future. She dreams of having a more spacious and more durable house to live in, and also to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To pay for fish nets, ropes, bamboo, and labor in making fish cages

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace G. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 20 years old. Mary Grace is single and has an infant. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es: Juan David M. M. de 27 años de edad, vive en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Juan se encuentra casado  vive con su esposa, su hija de 6 años de edad y su suegra. Juan posee una panadería donde trabaja el y su esposa, el negocio de Juan ha ido creciendo poco a poco, son cuatro años los que lleva dirigiendo su negocio el cual ahora tiene mucha demanda, es por ello que solicita un crédito, para compra de insumos utilizados en la elaboración de pan.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: How

texts.en: How S. is 22 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband currently work in construction. This couple have given birth to one young child. How S. finds it hard commuting to her work place, because she doesn't have her own vehicle for riding needs. Therefore, she requests a loan to purchase an old motorbike which she will use to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorbike

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios L. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 48 years old. Remedios is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing dress making services to local community members. Remedios is just starting this business.

Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie L., 41 years old is a rice farmer in Sto.Nino South Cotabato in Mindanao. She ahs three children, 22 years old the eldest who inpire her always to work harder to be able to buy the baisc needs at home. It was Octonber of 2006 that she started accessing loans from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She likes the program a lot that is why she stayed as CEVI client until now. 

She would like to request for another loan in CEVI worth Php 15,000. She will use her loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necesities to have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Peng

texts.en: Peng S., 29, is a married mother of two school-aged children and resides with her family in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of manufacturing silk in a traditional way, earning US $2 per day. Her husband has to travel to the city everyday to sell silk for her and other local silk producers, earning US $3 per day, their combined income being the primary means of support for the family. Both Peng and her husband work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family, and  she is now asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more silk from the  villagers to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada O. is from the village of Gumbil,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Librada is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Librada owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Librada has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Librada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Librada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Librada is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Librada from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: S., 23, is a single man, a firewood seller. He also goes to carve firewood them from the forest to retail in his house. He now lives with his old mother who helps him in selling carving wood. S. would like to ask a loan to increase his business capital. He purposes to use half of the loan to buy an old boat machine for fishing.

loans.use: To increase his business capital

loans.name: Magdalena Mirtala

texts.es: Magdalena Mirtala P. D. R. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en Soyapango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Magdalena vive con su esposo y su hija estudiante D. bachillerato D. 16 años D. edad, posee su propio negocio el cual tiene instalado en su casa, donD.  confecciona ropa a la medida y diferentes tipos D. prendas deportivas para los alumnos D. escuelas, el  crédito que solicita Magdalena es para comprar tela  que utilizara para confeccionar prendas deportivas.
texts.en:
Magdalena Mirtala P. D. R. is 49 years old and lives in the town of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She is married and has a 16 year old daughter who attends high school. Magdalena operates her own business out of her home in which she manufactures clothing and different types of sportswear for students.

The loan Magdalena is requesting will be used to buy fabric for making sportswear.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

Erline owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Erline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Erline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
47-year-old Rolinda P. is a rice farmer from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, in Mindanao. Her entire life has been spent on the farm. She said that tilling the farm and growing the rice plants are not hard subjects to learn.

Rolinda would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her farm by buying farming necessities to grow her harvest. She is hoping that she will be able to have a good return on investment from her CEVI loan.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo M. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misa mis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Ireneo is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ireneo owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling meat products  in the local community. Ireneo has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 20,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ireneo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ireneo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ireneo is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ireneo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Key

texts.en: Key V. was born in 1969 and is a married woman. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province. She has four children, four of whom are employed and earn money to help meet with family's living expenses. Since 2005, Key V. has run a business selling fish in local Psa Kraom Market, and is currently earning an average of $3 each day. Her husband is a local carpenter. Because fish selling is the main way for her to earn money, she would like a loan to accrue a quantity of fresh fish to sell. This will provide her with additional incomes.

loans.use: To accrue a quantity of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. reside en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Es madre soltera vive con su hijo José de 18 años de edad. María ha sacado adelante a su hijo con muchos esfuerzos y  su empeño en darle lo mejor, ha hecho de José un hombre de bien, estudioso y trabajador, María posee un negocio donde vende tortillas y leña, el crédito que está solicitando es para comprar maíz y leña al por mayor, de esta manera lograra obtener mayor margen de ganancias por sus ventas.

loans.use: Comprar de maiz y leña

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M., 45 years old is a rice grower in Sto. Nino South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has five children and her eldest child who is 26 started to work and no longer live with them. Her family maintained a 1-hectare of farm. They got small share of the harvest from the real owners of the land as payment for their labor.

Now she would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 to be able to buy the farming necesities to grow her harvest. She dreamed that someday she will be able to buy her own farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say R., 46 years old, is a grower from the Siem Reap Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of crops like, rice, cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running the business for more than twenty years. Say R. is married to Mr. yeb Youn who works fishing. She has now six children: one is single and the other five are married and live away from the family home. Say R. will be using her loan to hire the carvers to cut her matured crop.

loans.use: To hire the carvers to cut her matured crop

texts.es: Mirian Estela O. D. V. resiD. en Soyapango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Vive son sus dos hijos y su  esposo quien se dedica a su negocio un taller D. estructuras metálicas y Miriam por su parte atienD. D. su negocio una venta D. tortillas instalada en su domicilio, el  crédito que solita Mirian es para ambos negocio comprando una nueva plancha para sus tortillas y surtiendo D. hierro en el negocio D. estructuras metálicas.
texts.en:
Mirian Estela O. D. V. lives in the town of Soyapango, which is in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her two children and her husband, who has his own metal workshop business. Mirian attends to her business of selling tortillas out of her home.

She is requesting a loan for both businesses. Mirian plans to buy a new cook top for preparing tortillas as well as iron for her husband’s business of manufacturing metal structures.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new cook top for preparing tortillas & iron for her husband's metal workshop

texts.es: Juan H. G. reside en Nahuizalco en el departamento de Sonsonate, Juan vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando. El lugar de Nahuizalco es muy característico por sus artesanos y los productos que elaboran, Juan no es la excepción, el se dedica a la fabricación de sombreros, canastas y todo tipo de adorno en mimbre, palma  y otros materiales, el crédito que solicita Juan es para comprar materia prima que le permita aumentar su producción, ya que son artículos tuenen mucha demanda en su pueblo y en el país de Guatemala donde también los exporta.
texts.en:
Juan H. G. resides in Nahuizalco in the department of Sonsonate. Juan lives with his wife and two children who are students. Nahuizalco is known for its craftsmen and the products they make. Juan is no exception; he is dedicated to making hats, baskets and many other types of ornaments made of wicker, palms and other materials. The loan Juan is requesting will be used to purchase premium materials that will allow him to increase production, since his items are in great demand in his town and in the country of Guatemala where he also exports.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for his products

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:

Elna has a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm which she has managed for a long time now. Her husband died because of illness and she is solely supporting her family.

Elna would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying farming necessities. The loan will be truly helpful since she doesn't currently have enough ready cash to support her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Beverly owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Beverly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers. Its leader, Mrs. In S., 54, has been fisH. with her husband for years. This couple can make their daily income of $4 a day to contribute their family's living expenses. In S. has given birth to four children; two of them are married, while other two are single and also help their parent's fisH.. In S. requests a loan to buy more fisH. tool which she uses to increase her productivity. The other three borrower are:
H., a fish seller, who is asking for a loan to accrue her business capital.
S. is applying for a loan to buy additional tool for fisH..
S. will be using a Kiva loan for capital in order to buy tool for fisH. activity. Note: S. was not available for photograpH., so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tool

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia D. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 58 years old. Cresencia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sithis

texts.en: Sithis N., 45, is a widow who resides with two of her children in the Battambang province. Since 2000, she has been making and selling brooms to earn a living and is able to make US$3 of profit every day. Sithis is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more materials to make more brooms.

loans.use: Sell brooms.

loans.name: Otilia De Jesús

texts.es: Otilia De Jesús U. reside en ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador, tiene 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos José de 19 años y Edwin de 4 años de edad. Otilia posee su propio negocio donde vende tortas, el negocio se ubicado en un centro comercial donde hay mucha afluencia de personas y tiene a su favor una clientela muy estable, ya que son trece años de experiencia en su venta de tortas, el crédito que solita es para compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para tortas

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R., 34 years old is a rice gropwer from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has four children, 14 years old the eldest who are all studying. She started having a farm since 1990. Now, she is managing nearly 1-hectare farm that she hopes could provide her family enough income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay for the rice seeds and laborer who helped prepare the soil. In that way, she expects that she will be able to have more harvest to support her family well.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou P. is 20 years old and sells fruit with her old mother in Battambang province. Her mother is shown at home in the photo. Nou’s business has been around for about two years and she makes a combined US$5 every day.

Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Nou is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to expand her fruit stand. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will enable her to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To expand her fruit stand

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica C. D. G. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Rosa tiene 66 años D. edad vive con su hija y su pequeño nieto. Rosa es madre soltera ha sido muy trabajadora y responsable para darle lo mejor a su hija, hace veinte años instalo una tienda la cual hasta el día D. ahora es la que genera el ingreso fijo D. Rosa, el deseo D. ella es seguir en su negocio y es por ello que solicita este crédito, para surtir su tienda la cual necesita D. mercadería nueva para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica C. D. G. resides in the department of Ahuachapán. Rosa is 66 years old and lives with her daughter and young grandson. Rosa is a single mother and has been very hard working and responsible so that she could give her daughter the best. Twenty years ago she set up a store, and to this day she generates an income for herself. Her desire is to continue her business. It is for that reason she requests this loan, to stock her shop which needs new merchandise to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Moun T., 52, is married and resides with four of her children in the Battambang province. Since 2000, she and her husband have been making and selling rice noodle to earn approximately US$5 of profit every day. Three of the children are employed with different jobs. Moun T. is asking a loan of US$1200 to purchase more rice, wood and ingredients to make rice noodle to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, wood and ingredients to make noodle.

loans.name: Kil's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four low-income people. Mrs. Kil N., 54, has been selected to be the leader by the group members. Kil N. sells a few cakes to her neighbors for a daily profit, while her husband works at carrying loads at a local fish market. The couple has given birth to six children; one of them sells souvenirs to tourists.

Kil N. will be using her first loan to repair her existing house that is in poor condition. The other three borrowers who have jointly requested this loan are:

S., who requests a loan to buy ingredients continue selling cakes; N., who will be using her loan to repair her old house;

R., who is applying for a loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To repair her existing house that is in poor condition

loans.name: Leut

texts.en: Leut R., 27, is a recycler who resides with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. Every day, she walks around with her bicycle to buy recycling items in her village to earn a living and is able to make US$ 2 a day, while her husband is a private company staff member and makes US$ 3 a day to help support the family. To make more money, Mrs. Leut R. would like to take out a loan of US$ 400 to expand her recycling business.

loans.use: To expand her recycling business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Mrs. Julia D. is 57 years of age. She lives in Tabon, Jose Dalman and is married to Pancrasio, a former barangay captain. She has three children.

Mrs. D. is a member of a special program of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is being offered her third loan in the program because of her performance to the Paglaum. She is being loaned Php 14,900 for additional capital for her sari-sari store.

Now she is very happy for her business to make big improvements. She is happy that Kiva's partner, Paglaum MPC, is her constant partner. They provide her capital needs as well as life insurance for her whole family.

loans.use: Addittional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: C. is a 39-year-old widowed mother. She has three children; one of them appears in the picture with her. C. currently works in construction to earn a living. She said that she finds it hard traveling to work because she doesn't have her own transport. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan in order to buy an old motorcycle to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle to ride to work

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad S. is 57 years of age. She live in Tabon, Jose Dalman and has four children. One of her children is married and the other three are already working.

Mrs. S. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, which could be described as PAGLAUM DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM FOR LANDLESS PEOPLE. She has been a member for two years now.

She is happy to be a member of this program because it can help her raise additional capital for her business. It can also help with life insurance and savings deposits. She is already on her third cycle of loans.

She deeply wishes that her little business will succeed.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: S. is a local rice farmer. She, 29, is married with three children. All of them are going to school. As another source of family income comes from her husband works as an internal staff for a Hotel. S. is taking out a loan in order to decorate her old house.

loans.use: To decorate her old house

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura J. is from the village of Manamong. She is 51 years old. Maura is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maura owns & operates a sari-sari store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maura has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005,Maura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maura has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Maura is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Maura from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Concesa

texts.en:
Concesa A. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Concesa is starting a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business will come from raising pigs for sale. She plans to use revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

In 2008, Concesa joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase some construction materials for her house. Concesa is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to complete the window grills. This loan will be her second from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete the window grills

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Cecilia joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Mrs. Zoraida E. is 34 years of age and a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is a mother of five children, mostly at their minor stage. Zoraida is married to Alfredo E. Sr., who is presently employed as a mechanic at RN Builders. He has worked there for five years and earns a meager income.

Zoraida's family is experiencing financial hardship in meeting all its needs. Two years ago, Zoraida decided to engage in a ready-to-wear clothes dealing business. A year ago, she also started a business selling lumpia (a type of spring roll) and longganisa (a type of Filipino sausage). Now she is earning an average net income of 4,500 PHP a month, which is of great help to her family. As a new member just this month of Kiva partner PMPC, she has been given the privilege of applying for her first loan of 7,000 PHP as capital for her existing business activities. She is very happy and thankful for the trust given to her. Her future plan is to expand her business activities into other areas.

loans.use: As additional capital for her existing businesses

location.town: P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Grace Marie

texts.en:
Grace Marie T. is from the village of Casusan. She is 32 years old. Grace Marie is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Grace Marie owns & operates a Buy & Sell of Softdrinks business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling softdrinks in retail to the local community. Grace Marie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Grace Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC. Grace Marie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Grace Marie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.en:
Maria Ana S. is from Tinago, city of Ozamis. She is 33 years old and married to Vicente S. and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Ana owns and operates a “sari-sari’ store business in the retail sector running a general store, selling a variety of products to local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Maria Ana S. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maria Ana S. is requesting a new loan of 9,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maria Ana S. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions from the borrower’s family.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her business a general store(sari-sari store)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B., 44 years old is a rice farmer. Everyday she tills her small hectare of rice field which she hopes could provide her family their needs like food, clothes, medicines and income to pay the school.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy the farming needs. receiving this loan is worthwhile because she doesn't have ready cash to support her business now. With her loan, she hopes that she will be able to double her harvest to support her family more.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Elvira is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Fedelita

texts.en:
Fedelita S., 32 years old, owns and manages a small rice field in their village. She is one of the people who supplies rice to rice traders in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. The income she makes from growing rice is what she uses to buy food, clothes, and other basic needs at home.

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the needed materials to improve her harvest. She said that receiving this loan is truly helpful since she doesn't know where to get cash to pay the laborers who help till her farm and buy farming necessities.

She has just started as a CEVI client. She likes the program and wishes to access more loans in the future.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Birungi

texts.en: R. is 30mrried with seven children aged between 18 and 30 years. Two of her children go to schooland the rest finished school.  She takes care of additional family members R. resides and owns a five roomed house where she is staying with seven people and she is constructing her own house. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Makerere Kikoni .R. works seven days a week.  R. owns shop selling second hand shoes in Makerere Kinoni.. She buys her merchandise from Owino one of the busiest markets in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping R. pays 50500/=as monthly rent for business premises.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole saleR. has been in this business for two year and with MCDT for one year  servicing her third loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand shoes and pay rent R. is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop

loans.use: To buy more second hand  shoes

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora C. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business venture in the services sector running a beauty parlor business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general beauty services. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 45 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Nora joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nora is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC. Nora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. is a rice farmer. She owns and tills a one-hectare farm from which she hopes to provide her family with enough income to buy food and meet the costs of daily living. Erlinda's parents are farmers and she learned her farming skills from them.

Now, Erlinda needs additional capital to continue to sustain the family livelihood. She would like to request a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to fund her farm by buying the farming supplies she needs to grow her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou M. is from the village of Looc Proper. She is 29 years old. Marylou is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marylou owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Marylou is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marylou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marylou is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marylou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en: Berna is a 33 married with three children aged between 10 and 16 years. All her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Berna resides and rents a four roomed house where she is staying with seven people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Mengo Bakuli. Berna works seven days a week.  She owns stall selling old clothes. She buys her clothes from owino market’t incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Besides this clothing busienss, she also rears chicken   Berna pays monthly market dues as rent.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale Berna has been in this business for two years and with MCDT for six years servicing her fifteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes and chicks Hadjah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start going to buy directly from villages.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes and chicks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old and married with five children between 14 and 27 years. Two of her children still go to school and she also takes care of additional family members. Alice rents a two room house, with electricity and piped water, where she is staying with three people. The family gets three meals a day. Alice resides and works seven days a week in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala in Kawala.

Alice owns a meat store in Kawala which sells beef and receives at least 30 customers a day. She buys the meat from the Kampala city abattoir which she reaches by public transport. Alice pays 40000/= a month rent for her business premises. She sells retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Alice has been in this business for five years. She has been with Kiva partner MCDT for two years, is servicing her fourth loan and working with the same group mates. She plans to use this loan to buy more meat for resale. Alice aspires to see her business grow and employ other people.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Sauda Nakanwagi 's Group

texts.en:
Sauda, age 50, is married with seven children between the ages of 18 and 30. Two of her children go to school and the rest have finished school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sauda rents a two-roomed house where she lives with four other people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. She ensures that the family gets three meals a day. She is also in the process of constructing a house for her family.

Sauda lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala in Mulago. She works seven days a week. Sauda owns a retail shop in Mulago, selling daily-use merchandise both in wholesale and retail. The monthly rent on her business premises is 46,500 UGX. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo, one fof the busiest places in the city of Kampala and uses public transport to get to and from shopping. She has been in this business for one year and has been with MCDT for six months. This will be the second loan she and her group mates have obtained from MCDT.

Sauda wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop. She dreams of seeing her business grow bigger and of someday owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Teofanny

texts.en:
Teofanny L. is a 49-year-old woman from the village of Mambajao, in the Camiguin province, located in the Philippines.  Teofanny is married, and she has four adult children.  To make a living, Teofanny owns and operates a business making and selling food.  Her business income comes primarily from selling snacks, such as buttered banana in the local community.  Teofanny has been involved in her business for over a year, and she earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

Teofanny joined HSPFI in 2009 to access financial services and engage in business activities, which will help improve her living situation.  Teofanny is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make her food products.  This will be Teofanny's first loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

Norma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory as well as serving as working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida P., age 37, is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin Province. Brigida and her husband have four school-aged children. To make a living, Brigida owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like banana and hot cakes in the local community. Brigida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Brigida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her aim was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Brigida is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Brigida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Gina

She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. This loan will be Gina's fourth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: D. Jacqueline est née vers 1973 à Dogbo au Sud du Bénin. Jacqueline est mariée à METO René, un revendeur. Jacqueline est mère de trois enfants. C’est Jacqueline et son mari qui assurent ensemble les dépenses du foyer. C’est les produits de quincaillerie que Jacqueline vend. Jacqueline a sa boutique de quincaillerie au carrefour Aglouza à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Jacqueline a déjà huit ans d’expérience dans cette activité. C’est au Ghana, État voisin du Bénin que Jacqueline achète ses produits de quincaillerie. Jacqueline veut augmenter le volume de son activité mais il lui manque des moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est pourquoi Jacqueline s’est approchée d’ALIDé pour avoir un crédit.
texts.en:
Jacqueline D. was born around 1973 in Dogbo, in the south of Benin. Jacqueline is married to René Meto, a secondhand dealer, and has three children. Jacqueline and her husband take care of their household expenses together. Jacqueline sells hardware accessories from her store in the Aglouza Carrefour, in Cotonou - the economic capital of Benin. Jacqueline already has 8 years of experience in this business. She purchases her products in Ghana, Benin's neighboring state. Jacqueline would like to increase the sales volume of her business, but she is lacking the financial means to do so. This is why she has approached Alidé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware and building supplies

Sylvia works seven days a week selling second hand clothes. She first buys them in Owino market and so incurs extra costs in traveling to and from the market. She also pays a monthly rent of 5000/=. She then sells her clothes to her customers at both retail and wholesale prices. 

Sylvia has been in this business for three years. Working with the same group mates, Sylvia has been servicing her first loan from MCDT for the past six months. She is requesting a new loan to buy more second hand clothes. Sylvia would like to see her business grow bigger and start importing clothes directly.

Currently, she owns a 2-hectare rice field and 4 pigs. She has been a member of CEV for more than 2 years already. According to her, CEV has really helped her family especially her business. She said that apart from the low-interest financial service, she feels secured because of its insurance program. Ofelia is requesting for a loan of Php15, 000 to increase her working capital. This loan will truly be helpful in her business.
