She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Lugala Masanafu zone. Sylivia works seven days a week. She buys her cream relaxers and cosmetics from kampala city shops in Kikuubo one of the busiest places in kampala city and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent as she rears from her home She works upon all categories of people Sylvia has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for one week, servicing her first loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy morecream relaxers and cosmetics. Sylivia is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start a bridal salon.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah owns a piggery farm where she rears pigs to sell. Sarah is 37 years old and she is married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more piglets to rear and sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon D. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 38 years old. Corazon is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Corazon is just starting this business.

In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Corazon from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Margionila

texts.en:
Going into business on your own is sometimes tough it but can also provide a good living if you are patient, determined, and stay focused on the finish line, which is the achievement of your dream. This is what Margionila D. believes and has experienced as a micro-entrepreneur. She is now 58 years old and married with five children who are between the age of 9 and 33. The family lives in the village of Purok Flower, Barangay Cervants, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.

Because of her ambition to provide a good future for her five children, Margionila put up a general store to help her husband support their family. At first she only sold basic household commodities because of the fast turnover of these products. For several years, she continued to just rotate her capital, putting most of the profits back into the business after using just a small portion for the education of her children. But later, she knew she needed to expand her business to earn more because her family's needs was also growing.

This is the reason why Margionila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon: so that she could have additional capital; so that she could earn more and afford to send her children to college. In spite of the ups and downs in her business, she was relentless in her struggle to sustain her children's education and, when the older kids graduated and started earning their own living, she was able to breathe more freely, but she did not stop working.

With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Margionila was able to buy a motorized fishing boat which earns additional income for her. The daily catch, whether it is fish or crabs, is usually sold in the local market or bought by her regular customers.

The previous loan of PHP 19,500 that Margionila borrowed was used for her fishing business. She was able to pay it off on time without any delays in the weekly installments. This time, she is only borrowing PHP 6,000 for her 13th loan because she only needs this much additional capital for her general store, as she anticipates that because it is going to be off-season for the sugar industry in the coming months.

Margiolina is shown in the picture posing in her motorized fishing boat.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady D. est une marchande sise devant chez elle dans un quartier populaire de Thies au Sénégal.Elle est agée de 56 ans et connait très bien son domaine qui l'a occupé depuis très longtemps. Mariée à un vieux nommé Monsieur A.B. GUEYE, Madame Khady D. GUEYE sollicite un pret de 100 000 frs cfa. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux faire face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle afin de gagner plus et de mieux s'occuper des besoins  de son mari qu'elle aime tant.

loans.use: acheter des legumes, du poisson, de la pate d'arachide, l'huile de palme, etc pour les vendre

loans.name: Biliky

texts.en: Biliky is a young married woman with a child. She is 21 years old.  She sells planks at plank market in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to pull her family above poverty. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Sheriff Business Group

texts.en:
'S. business' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Mariama S., 37 years old, married with 6 children aged 7-19 years. Their educational levels are 1st grade to high school graduate. She also cares for 1 orphan.

Mariama is illiterate due to the fact that back then, Muslims and the Mandingo tribe did not like sending their girl children to school. Education and leadership were for men only, but now this has changed.

Mariama lives in a poor and deserted community called Bassa town, Perry Community, Brewerville, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Mariama's business is buying textiles wholesale and selling them retail to the residents of Brewerville, Monrovia, Liberia. This business enables her to feed and cater for herself and her children. Mariama does not have a shop, therefore she carries the cloth around on her head to sell to her customers; rainy can be very difficult for her business.

Mariama has been running this business for 14 years and is grateful for whatever this business has done for her. Mariama has hopes of importing textiles from abroad and owning a store in order to make business easier for her, instead of carrying goods on her head. She sells good textiles at a reasonable price to encourage her customers to keep buying from her.

Mariama needs this loan in order to purchase a variety of textiles that can serve her customers. She also dreams of making a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase variety of textiles for resale

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena G. is a 31-year-old single parent living in Barangay Talab-an, a part of Manapla Municipality in Negros Occidental Province. She is not married because her fiancé became sick and died before their wedding, leaving her pregnant with their baby. Even though she must support her five-year-old daughter alone, she is determined to provide a good future for her child.

Left alone to fend for her baby girl, Gena decided to establish her own business with the help of start-up capital from her mother so that she could support her young daughter and herself. As she moved on with her life, the pain of losing her child's father lessened, especially as she busied herself with building her general store and raising her daughter.

As her business slowly grew, Gena saw new opportunities for expansion. In 2006 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could add to her capital and expand her business. The loans she received from NWTF-Project Dungganon enabled her to diversify into food vending, including selling frozen food in her general store. The business now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP, which she uses for household expenses and in savings for her daughter's future. The rest she plows back into the business.

In her eighth loan cycle she borrowed 19,500 PHP to add to her revolving working capital. She was able to pay back the weekly installments on time and in full within the loan term. Now Gena is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP for her ninth cycle. With it she intends to increase her inventory a little more so that she can build her savings for the future security of her small family.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her general store

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther Maria Sampon tiene 44 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 12 años que empezó a trabajar, junto a su hijo de años quien es su razón más importante para salir adelante. Ella es una mujer amable y trabajadora, por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y preparar a su hijo por lo que tiene que asistir a clases y además tiene que ayudarlo con las tareas del colegio, sin embargo con todas las dificultades que ha tenido que pasar como es el poco tiempo que le dedica a la venta de ropa, no le impide salir adelante y ofrecer sus productos. Por lo que con mucho esfuerzo con un bolso en su hombro recorre las diferentes comarcas, en busca de clientes. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de mercadería. En un futuro le gustaría establecer su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Esther Maria Sampon, 44, sells used clothes. She started working over 12 years ago, and she took her small son with her. He is her most important reason for getting ahead. She is a kind, hard-working woman. Every day she gets up early to do her household chores and get her son ready for school. She also has to help him with his school work. Nevertheless, with all of the difficulties she has gone through like being able to only spend a small amount of time selling clothes, it does not stop her from getting ahead and offering her products. With great effort she travels the different regions with her bag on her should looking for customers. That is why she is asking for a loan for working capital to buy merchandise. In the future she would like to establish her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida B. is 45 years old and married to Alfredo B., who is a 46-year-old tricycle driver. They have three children, two of whom already have their own families. The youngest, who is eleven, lives with them and goes to elementary school. The B. family lives in the village of Purok Pasil (Zone 1) within Cadiz City, located in Negros Occidental province.

As a tricycle driver, her husband's earnings can sometimes be erratic. Shuttling people around town in a motorcycle with a passenger sidecar cannot always be counted on as a stable source of income; in bad and rainy weather, his income can be virtually nil. Knowing this pushed Aida to make use of her tailoring skills to supplement her husband's income and provide their family with a steadier income.

In 2000 Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and, using an NWTF loan plus her dressmaking and tailoring skills, she began a tailoring business. Because she was a good designer and a skilled seamstress, she soon had many loyal patrons who regularly went to her when they needed clothes. Her tailoring business earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP, enough to pay for her daughter's school expenses as well as defray some of their household expenses.

Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 for working capital for her business was paid on time and in full without delay. Now she is requesting a loan of the same amount for working capital for her tailoring business, and her profits will be used to help supplement the family income.

The above picture shows Mrs. Aida B. with her husband, Alfredo, in her tailoring shop.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To add to her capital for her tailoring business

loans.name: Luceritos De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
“Luceritos De Los Andes”, es el nombre que agrupa una asociación de once personas, se reúnen en el centro focal Los Andes hace tres años aproximadamente y realizan sus actividades de forma responsable.
La base de los negocios que tiene este grupo son los alimentos, por ejemplo Lidia y Fanny se dedican a la venta de pescado crudo, en ferias de la zona, Nincolaza  elabora y vende almuerzos , Victoria comercia con verduras, German tienen una tienda de abarrotes. Las socias precisan capital para poder realizar la compra de  insumos y productos,
texts.en:
“Luceritos De Los Andes” is the name of a group of 11 persons who have been meeting in the Promujer Los Andes central office for approximately 3 years, and who carry out their activities in a responsible manner. Most of the members are involved in businesses related to food, for example, Lidia and Fanny sell raw fish in the markets in the area, Nincolaza produces and sells lunches, Victoria sells vegetables, and German has a grocery store. The members need capital in order to purchase supplies and products for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and products

loans.name: Be Faithful Group

texts.en:
'Be Faithful'  is a group of 5 borrowers led by Helen W., 46 years old, a widow with 6 children aged 10-28 years old. Their educational levels are 1st grade through high school graduate. Helen also cares for 2 orphans. Helen is a 9th grade drop-out due to lack of support.

She lives around the Baby-mom junction, Perry Town community, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Perry Town is a community that is very crowded and is also full of people who can’t afford a daily meal. 

Helen’s business is selling palm oil retail in the Duala market, north of Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 4 years and saving her profit is what makes her still be able to maintain her business. She also talks to her customers nicely, and that is another method she uses to get customers.

Helen needs this loan in order to purchase more oil wholesale to sell to gain more profit. She is hoping to become a successful businesswoman and dreams of educating her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase more oil wholesale

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is married with 2 children, and she is 34 years old. She sells sarongs and tailoring materials to make a living. Queen is requesting the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es: Victoria Y. es una de las fundadoras de la asociación “25 de Julio” del  centro Focal Santiago II, en la ciudad de El Alto, ella al igual que muchas de sus compañeras realiza diversas actividades para poder llevar el sustento a su familia, Victoria realiza viajes a la ciudad de Oruro para comprar variedad de artículos para el hogar (platos, ollas, vasos etc.) y luego los vende en la feria 16 de Julio (El Alto). Ella al igual que sus compañeras afirma que los créditos que obtengan serán invertidos para reforzar sus negocios, adquiriendo mercadería variada. Ya que sus demás compañeras también venden mercadería variada, como ser; venta de calzados para niños, ropa interior, mantas y otros.
texts.en:
Victoria Y. is one of the founders of the "25 de Julio" (July 25th) group in the Santiago II regional office in the city of El Alto. Like many of the members of the group, Victoria does many different types of work in order to be able to put food on the table for her family. Victoria travels to the city of Oruro to buy various household items such as plates, pots, glasses, etc., and then sells them in El Alto's July 16th fair. Other group members also sell assorted products such as children's footwear, underwear, blankets, and more. Victoria and the rest of the group plan to use the loan to strengthen their businesses, and to purchase assorted merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as plates, pots, glasses, children's footwear, underwear, and blankets

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí, el señor Alvaro G. se dedica a atender su negocio de farmacia el cual lo inició desde hace nueve años y poco a poco lo ha venido desarrollando y ampliando.

Es importante destacar que el señor Alvaro es muy trabajador y se esfuerza mucho por mejorar la situación de su negocio y así suplir las necesidades de su familia que tanto depende de él.

loans.use: Compra de medicamentos

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Carlos T. se desde muy jovencito se ha dedicado al trabajo en el campo por medio de la agricultura y el sector pecuario en el municipio de Condega en Estelí. Ha sido esta la actividad por la cual ha beneficiado a su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar. Actualmente está trabajando tanto en la agricultura como en la crianza de ganado por lo que se esfuerza para mantener dicho ganado y de esta manera sacarle el máximo provecho.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo invertirá directamente en la compra del ganado como lo son terneras para proceder a su crianza y así continuar beneficiando a su familia por medio de su actividad.

loans.use: Compra de terneras

loans.name: Vision 2 Group

texts.en:
'Vision 2' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Hawa Q., 39 years old, a widow with 5 children, aged 4-18 years old. Their educational levels are nursery to 9th grade. Hawa is a high school graduate but couldn't continue her education because of early pregnancy. Later, when Hawa's husband died, she had to be responsible for her children. The business has been a great help to her family.

Hawa lives and works in Perry town, Sonnie yard, which is a poor community that depends on the government to take care of them; it is in the north of Monrovia, Liberia.

Hawa’s business is dry goods. She purchases goods like oil, candles, matches, bleach, etc. wholesale and sells retail to the residents of Perry town, Sonnie yard, Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for over 10 years and started the business with a small working capital but is doing fine in business.

Her difficulty was when a thief broke into her house and stole her business capital. She nearly got discouraged but she realised that she didn't have anyone to help her but the business, so she continued striving.

Hawa brings good products to the market, and she also has good relations with her customers so as to encourage them to always come to buy from her.  She needs this loan in order to purchase more dry goods wholesale and acquire more profit and expand her business. Hawa has hopes of growing her business and becoming a successful businesswoman. And she dreams of her and her children becoming a successful family in the future.

loans.use: in order to purchase more dry goods wholesale

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Javier de Jesús P. T., tiene  54 años de edad, es casado y junto a su esposa tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. El señor Javier es dueño de un negocio de venta de medicamentos, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. Don Javier dio inicio a su negocio hace 8 años, el dio inicio debido a que el tenia problemas pero un amigo lo ayudo para que pudiera establecer un negocio y mantenerse ocupado. Por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo .El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de medicamentos ampliar su zona de atención, y además vender en algunos buses en donde recurren bastantes clientes que viajan y aquí Javier encuentra la manera de ofrecer sus productos. El  sueño de Javier es mantenerse en el mercado, debido a que la competencia es bastante grande, además que desea invertir más para de esta manera y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sr. Javier de Jesús P. T. is 54 years old, married, and has three adult children. He sells medicines as a traveling merchant and has been in business for 8 years. He had problems getting started, but a friend helped him establish his business and remain busy. Don Javier is a very responsible man who enjoys his work.

His loan will be used to purchase more medicines so that he can expand his sales territory. He plans to to offer his products to customers who travel into his community by bus. Javier dreams of maintaining his share of the market because the competition is fairly large. He hopes to invest more into his business so that he can generate additional earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase more medicine

loans.name: Oneyda

texts.es:
La señora Oneyda M. se dedica a la actividad de elaboración de artesanías típicas realizándolas en su taller artesanal donde ha trabajado por más de cinco años habiendo adquirido los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora pero hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de la materia prima como es la madera para así continuar elaborando las artesanías para ofrecerlas a sus clientes que le visitan en el municipio de Condega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oneyda M. is in the business of making traditional handicrafts in her artist workshop. She has earned her living working in her shop for over five years. Oneyda stands out as a hard worker, but now finds she needs to invest in the purchase of raw materials, like wood. With this loan, she can continue making her handicrafts to offer to her customers who visit the town of Condega.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es:
La señora Magdali P. C. se dedica a laborar en su establecimiento en el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí donde posee su propio negocio de pulpería ofreciendo todo tipo de productos comestibles a sus clientes.

Es importante mencionar que como todo negocio en desarrollo, la señora Magdali requiere invertir en la pulpería por medio de las compras de los productos y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra del productos y así ofertarlo en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de los productos

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ervin Francisco

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí, el señor Ervin G. se dedica arduamente a laborar en su propio negocio de venta de ropa la que es exhibida en vitrinas y a la vez se dedica a la elaboración de anuncios publicitarios con materiales especiales y ofrecidos a todo tipo de negocios habiéndose destacado en esta labor por ser muy creativo y realizando trabajos muy profesionales.

La razón por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que lo necesita mucho para la compra de la ropa para continuar ofertándola y también para la compra de los materiales de trabajo para elaborar los anuncios publicitarios y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Condega in the Estelí department, Ervin G. dutifully works at his own clothing sale business, which he displays in store windows. At the same time, he creates advertisements out of special materials for all types of businesses and has distinguised himself in his efforts by being very creative and producing very professional work. The reason he has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan is because he needs it to buy clothing so he can continue offering it and also to buy the materials for the production of his advertisements and publicity material, and in this way, he will continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and the material to make advertisements

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
These people are Zainab D., Fanta F., Sadia K. and Ramatu M.. They named their group 'In God We Trust' and made Zainab D. (in the middle) their leader. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni City. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000 to enable them to buy more goods to sell. With more goods at their disposal, they will be able to make more profit and thus improve their livelihood. 

Their leader, Zainab D. is now thirty-nine years old; she is married to a lorry driver and they have four children. Hawa’s children are attending school – two are in secondary schools, one in primary school, and the other is not of school-going age.  Hawa sells firewood, charcoal and women’s clothes. She has been a businesswoman for more than fifteen years now. Hawa will use this loan to invest in a new business – palm-oil, the most popular cooking oil. 

Attached below right is a group member (Ramatu M.) who was not present for the group photo.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: Alma Nubia O.  tiene la edad de 52 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es carpintería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con esfuerzo propio anteriormente no tenía un medio de trabajo por lo que no tenia ingresos para mantener a su familia, a pesar de los constantes problemas de salud no pero esto no le impidió seguir con este trabajo a pesar de ser mujer, ha logrado salir adelante.  Es así que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su negocio para capital de trabajo con herramientas necesarias, materia prima y mano de obra. El deseo de Alma es que su negocio progrese para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia O. is 52 and married. She is raising three children. She is a carpenter, and she has been in this business for over five years. She started through her own efforts. Previously, she did not have the means to work, and she did not have an income to support her family. In spite of constant health problems, she kept going with this work. In spite of being a woman, she has been successful. That is how she decided to ask for a loan for working capital to buy necessary tools, raw material, and pay for labor. Alma’s wish is that her business progresses and benefits her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sica

texts.fr: E. Sica est née le 06 Août 1956 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Sica est analphabète et réside à Abomey Calavi au Sud du Bénin depuis 18 ans. Mariée à TOMASSE Vincent, un commerçant, Sica est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Sica et son mari supportent les charges de la famille. Sica vend des divers (savons, lait, sardines, sucres, …), des sandales, des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, oignons, piments, légumes, épices, huile rouge de  palme, etc.) et du poisson à son domicile et au marché de Cococodji, au Sud du Bénin.  C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Sica achète ces différents produits. Sica ambitionne  agrandir le volume de son activité. C’est cette raison qui l’a poussée à se rapprocher de ALIDé pour obtenir de financement.
texts.en:
Sica E. was born August 6, 1956 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin. Sica is illiterate and has lived in Abomey Calavi in Southern Benin for the past 18 years. Married to Vincent Tomasse, a shopkeeper, Sica is the mother of three children who have all been educated. She and her husband are responsible for the family expenditures. Sica sells a variety of products; soaps, milk, sardines, sugar, sandals, condiments (tomatoes, onions, peppers, vegetables, spices, palm oil) as well as fish, from her home and at the market in Cococodji, in the South. Sica buys these products at Dantokpa, the main international market of Benin. She hopes to increase her sales volume, and it is for this reason that pushed her to apply for a loan through Kiva partner Alidé.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing three dozen soaps, a carton of milk, three cartons of sugar, and condiments for sauce.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Black Survivor  Business Group

texts.en:
Black Survivor Business is a group of 5 borrowers led by Bendu J., 37 years old and single, with a child aged 11 years old. 

Bendu was forced to leave school when she was in the 9th grade, because she got pregnant and was abandoned by her child’s father. She had no choice but to leave school to fend for herself and the child. She lives and sells goods in the Jah Tono a suburb around Monrovia, Liberia. This community was destroyed by the civil war, therefore people live in old and burnt houses.

Bendu’s business is buying dry goods like rice, candles, matches, oil, etc. and charcoal wholesale and selling them retail to the residents of Jah Tono community. She started this business 3 years ago. Bendu sells her customers good products just to maintain them. Sometimes Bendu's goods get damaged by the weather; that can sometimes discourage her, but she has to take care of her child.

Bendu needs this loan in order to to expand her business because her customers are numerous and her goods can't satisfy their needs. Bendu is hoping to become a successful businesswoman and educate her child so as to become a prominent person in society.

loans.use: Buying more goods for resale

loans.name: Las Chavalas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las chavalas está integrado por  María de los Ángeles B., María Auxiliadora Pavón R. y Estela García, ellas son originarias de camino viejo a los Brenes zona rural de Nindiri.

La coordinadora del grupo María de los Ángeles B. de  28 años, ella  tiene tres años con la venta de verduras y frutas como pipian, ayote, tomate, yuca y pepino entre otros en el mercado de Masaya y lo que más anhela es tener su propio tramo, ya que es vendedora ambulante.

 Las otras dos integrantes son  Estela García quien vende ropa usada y María Auxiliadora Pavón R. que produce todo tipo de platos tipos derivados del cerdo como nacatamal donde se mezclan la masa, carne, arroz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, papa, todo en rodajas; se terminado condimentar con dos chiles congos enteros y se pone cubieto en hojas de chagüiete a cocer. Otro de los platos es la moronga, el frito, el chicharrón, el chancho con yuca y la venta de carne.

loans.use: Para comprar frutas y verduras como yuca, pipian, ayote, naranjas entre otros.

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: K. Marcelle est née en 1981 à Azovè, au Sud du Bénin. Marcelle est mariée à OUINSOU Dodji, un employé de la société MAGUESTRO  à Cotonou au Bénin. Marcelle réside depuis trois ans à Hêvié au Sud du Bénin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marcelle est une couturière qui a pour activité secondaire la vente de tissus, de vêtements et de sous-vêtements qu’elle distribue à domicile. Marcelle ambitionne remplir sa boutique de tissus bazins et Hitarget. C’est la raison pour laquelle Marcelle s’est rapprochée de ALIDé pour obtenir un crédit.

loans.use: Achat de 05 pièces d tissus, 10 douzaines de sous-vêtements et de 02 rouleaux de tissus.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: K. Clotilde est née en 1980 à Covè au Sud du Bénin. Mariée à LOKO Martin un chauffeur, Clotilde est mère de deux enfants. Clotilde réside depuis six ans à Abomey-Calavi, au Sud du Bénin. Seul le conjoint de Clotilde supporte les charges de la famille. Clotilde exerce une activité de vente de sachets emballages qu’elle achète au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Clotilde a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Clotilde ambitionne devenir financièrement autonome et renforcer son fonds de roulement. C’est pour cette raison que Clotilde s’est rapprochée de ALIDé pour obtenir un crédit.
texts.en:
Clotilde K. was born in 1980 in Covè, Southern Benin. Married to Martin Loko, a chauffeur, Clotilde is the mother of two children. She has lived for the past six years in Abomey-Calavi, in Southern Benin. Clotilde and her husband alone are responsible for the family's finances. She works selling gift bags which she buys in Togo, the country next to Benin. Clotilde has ten years of experience working in this domain. She would like to become financially independent and build up her working capital. It is for this reason that she has approached Kiva partner Alidé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing dozens of gift bags

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: K. Léontine est née en 1981 à Adja au Sud du Bénin. Mariée à MISSIFAN Clément, un commerçant, et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, Léontine réside depuis quatre ans à Abomey-Calavi toujours au Sud du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus tirés des ventes, Léontine participe aux charges de la famille. Léontine est une couturière qui exerce également une activité de vente de produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, soja), et de condiments de sauce. Léontine achète ces différents produits à Azovè, Adja et Glo, les villages du Bénin et les vend à domicile. Léontine a déjà quinze (15) ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Léontine ambitionne développer son activité, mais il lui manque des moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est pour cela que Léontine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de 2 sacs de 100 kilogrammes de maïs, 1 sac de 100 kilogrammes de soja et 10 paniers de piments

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de céréales dans le marché de Hanoukopé à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1991 à Lomé, au moment où son mari militaire est allé à la retraite. Ils ont 02 enfants et c’est grâce à ce commerce que le couple arrive à assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle dispose de nombreux clients à qui elle vend en gros mais aussi en détail ; elle s’approvisionne à Amlamé, une localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle compte dans l’avenir disposer d'un autre point de vente au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle pense renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement en ce moment ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 sacs de maïs, 04 sacs d’haricots et 05 sacs de Soja. Elle a l’assurance qu’elle remboursera son prêt à temps, vu sa meilleure connaissance du marché.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, d'haricots et de soja

loans.name: Afi Ewayo

texts.fr: Cette femme joue un rôle financier très important dans son foyer ; elle contribue en effet dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 04 enfants, en apportant son aide financière à son mari. Elle est spécialisée uniquement dans la vente de tomates naturelles. Elle exerce son activité dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso, plus précisément à Ouagadougou, qui dispose l’une des meilleures tomates en Afrique de l’Ouest. C’est pourquoi cette dame dispose de nombreuses clientes ; et surtout les restaurants en mets africains font des commandes chez elle, à cause de la qualité de ses produits. Actuellement elle a besoin de lancer de nouvelles commandes, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 paniers de tomates fraîches.

loans.use: Achat de tomates

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: B. Juliette est née le 30 Avril 1978 à Bopa au Sud du Bénin. Juliette réside à Cocotomey toujours au Sud du Bénin depuis trois ans et est mariée à ZONON Lambert un chauffeur. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant, mais a un enfant scolarisé en charge. C’est le mari de Juliette seul qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Juliette d’utiliser ses revenus pour mieux développer son activité. Coiffeuse de profession, Juliette vend également des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son atelier situé à Cocotomey au Sud du Bénin. Juliette achète ces produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Juliette a déjà près de 2 ans d’expérience dans son activité. Juliette a bénéficié antérieurement d’un crédit à ALIDé ; elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit en vue d’augmenter le volume de son activité et d’agrandir de ce fait son atelier.

loans.use: Achat de 5 cartons de produits cosmétiques et 13 douzaines de mèches

loans.name: Akouwa Zoékpè

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Baguida à Lomé, plus précisément à Afanoukopé. Elle a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de quincaillerie ; elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2005 ; avec ce commerce elle arrive à aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 03 enfants. Elle reçoit beaucoup de clients, parce qu’il est rare de trouver une boutique de quincaillerie dans le coin. Elle veut effectuer certains achats en ce moment ; c’est pourquoi elle souhaite vivement obtenir un crédit de WAGES pour commander des produits de peintures manquants, des produits d’électricité et des produits de menuiserie. Elle est confiante qu’elle pourra respecter son échéancier de remboursement.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Baguida district in Lomé, in Afanoukopé to be exact. She has opened a store for selling hardware. She started this business in 2005. Through it, she manages to help her husband financially in educating their three children. She has many customers because it’s rare to find a hardware store in the area. She wants to make certain purchases at this time; this is why she earnestly wishes to obtain a WAGES loan for ordering products in short supplies: paint, electrical, carpentry. She is confident she’ll be able to honor her repayment schedule.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of moto-taxi

loans.name: Las Pechugas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las pechugas está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que son Daniela de Jesús  G. 

C., Claudia T. y Damaris R..


 La coordinadora del grupo Daniela de Jesús  G. C. de 19 años, ella con la ayuda de su suegra

 y su compañero de vida creo una pequeña panadería que actualmente distribuye en Masaya.  G.

 desea poder mejorar su negocio e invertir en los materiales necesarios como azúcar, harina, 

levadura entre otros.


Las otras dos integrantes son  Claudia T. de 25 años quien vende comida y cosméticos en la 

zona franca y Damaris R. de 35 años que vende ropa usada y productos de la Avon.
texts.en:
The Pechugas Group is comprised of three hard-working women; Daniela de Jesús G. C., Claudia T., and Damaris R.. Daniela de Jesús G. C., 19, is the group’s coordinator. She, with help from her mother-in-law and her life partner, created a small bakery that currently distributes in Masaya. G. wishes to be able to improve her business and invest in the necessary materials like sugar, flour, and leavening among other things. The other members are Claudian T., 25, who sells food and cosmetics in the custom’s free area, and Damaris R., 35, who sells used clothes and Avon products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, eggs, leavening, and other ingredients for the bakery

loans.name: Rev. Sheiku B.'s Group

texts.en:
This are members of a Vocational institute in Makeni. They want a loan of Le 18,000,0000 to help them meet their immediate needs. Some of them want the loan in order to invest in business, some to pay their childrens' school fees and other school related charges and others will like to invest the loan in a house building project. 

Rev. Sheiku B. K. is a teacher at the school and also head of this group. Sheiku wants this loan in order to embark on a house building project he has begun and also pay school fees for his children. Sheiku is a fifty-six years old man, born in Rokupr, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a state registered nurse and they have three children. One of their children is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III) and the others are in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III). Sheiku is a teacher at this Vocational institute and has been in the teaching profession for seventeen years now.

loans.use: Buy building materials like cements and iron corrugate zincs, and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Victoire est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui vend: des poteries, des plantes médicinales et du bois de chauffage à son domicile à Hêvié. Victoire achète ces produits à Tori au Sud du Bénin et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Victoire vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. Avec déjà cinq ans d’expérience dans le domaine, Victoire ambitionne agrandir son activité. Cette ambition l’a conduit à solliciter auprès d’ALIDé un crédit.

loans.use: Achat de poteries, de plantes médicinales et de deux camions de bois de chauffage

loans.name: Tettey

texts.fr: Cet homme habite le quartier de Kodjoviakopé à Lomé où elle a ouvert son atelier de couture ; ce tailleur à débuté cette activité depuis 1984 à Lomé. Il maîtrise bien son métier puisqu’il a derrière lui une longue année d’expérience. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 04 enfants. Il est très apprécié par la plupart de ses clients et dispose de 05 apprentis tailleurs ou couturières. Actuellement il a besoin d’une nouvelle machine à plinthe pour mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle ; c’est pour cela qu’il souhaite vivement avoir un crédit de WAGES pour en acheter une ; le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses fris de transport vers le Ghana pour effectuer l’achat
texts.en:
This is a man who lives in the Kodjoviakopé district in Lomé, where he opened a tailoring shop. This tailor started his business in 1984 in Lomé. He has a good command of his trade, since he has long years of experience under his belt. This business enables him in particular to provide for his wife and four children. He is highly valued by most of his customers and has five apprentice tailors or seamstresses. Currently, he needs a new sewing machine to respond better to customer expectations; this is why he earnestly wishes to obtain a WAGES loan in order to buy one. The rest of the loan will be used to cover his transport costs to Ghana for making the purchase.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: M. Odette est née le 15 Mai 1981 à Adja au Sud du Bénin. Odette réside à Cocotomey, une ville située au Sud du Bénin depuis deux ans. Odette est mariée à un militaire nommé SIDI Basile, et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Grâce à son activité de vente de produits vivriers (maïs, …), Odette supporte avec son mari les dépenses de la famille. Odette achète ces produits à Adja au Mono (Bénin) et les vend à son domicile à Cocotomey. Odette est à son premier crédit, mais a déjà deux ans d’expérience dans la vente de produits vivriers. Odette souhaite accroître cette activité, et sollicite pour cela un financement auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de 5 sacs de 100 Kilogrammes de maïs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Célestin

texts.fr: S. Célestin est né le 30 Juin 1963 à Houéyogbé, au Sud du Bénin. Marié et résidant à Cocotomey dans le Sud du Bénin depuis onze ans, Célestin est père de huit enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple participent eux deux aux dépenses de la famille. Célestin achète divers produits (farine de blé, sucre, huile, …) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin ; et confectionne des gâteaux qu’il vend. Célestin a déjà deux ans d’expérience dans ce métier. Dans l’optique d’accroître sa production journalière, Célestin a sollicité un financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Célestin S. was born June 30, 1963 in Houéyogbé in Southern Benin. He now resides in Cocotomey, where he has lived for eleven years. Célestin is the father of eight children, all of whom have been educated. He and his wife both contribute to paying the family's expenses. Célestin purchases a variety of products (wheat flour, sugar, oil, etc) at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and uses them to make cakes which he sells. He already has two years experience in this field. In order to increase his daily output, Célestin has approached Kiva partner Alidé for a loan.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of wheat flour and 5 50L drums of oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dédé Egalessi

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame a appris la coiffure ; en 2007, elle a ouvert dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé à Lomé son atelier de coiffure. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge ; mais cette activité lui permet de se prendre à charge et de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle dispose de nombreuses clientes dans le quartier ; mais également des femmes viennent des coins environnant pour se soigner leurs cheveux chez elle à cause de sa maîtrise du métier. Elle en profite également pour vendre des mèches et tissages et d’autres produits cosmétiques. En ce moment elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 mèches Nina, 50 mèches Curly, des produits cosmétiques et tissages de différentes couleurs et bien d’autres produits indispensables.

loans.use: Achat de mèches, tissages et produits cosmétiques

loans.name: 240003211 Group

texts.es:
Jovana del SocorroS. Mejía de 33 años, Catalina M. de 30 años y Luis M. de 52 años conforman el grupo Rosa Mística. Este grupo tiene cuatro años de trabajar con adim lo que le permitió iniciar con sus negocios.

Jovana S. vende fritanga en su hogar, la fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena. S. es la coordinadora del grupo   y lo que más desea es mejorar el local de su negocio y seguir trabajando por su familia.

Mientras Catalina M. tiene una pequeña pulpería surtida con granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz y dulces, chiverías, jabón, detergente y cloro entre otros. Y Luis M. vende prendas de oro en su casa y por encargo.
texts.en:
Jovana is 33 years old, Catalina is 30 years old, and Luis is 52 years old. They make up the Mystic Rose Group. This group has been working with ADIM for 4 years, and that has permitted them to initiate their businesses.

Jovana sells “fritanga” from her home – a "fritanga" is the popular restaurant par excellence in Nicaragua. This consists of selling foods that are simply cooked over a grate. Generally, these are bought for supper. Jovana is the group's coordinator and what she desires most is to improve her place of business and to keep on working for her family.

Meanwhile, Catalina has a small grocery store that carries basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, corn, sweets, snacks, soap, detergent and bleach, among other things. And Luis sells gold gifts from his house and by special order.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MEAT, PLANTAINS, CABBAGE, TOMATOES, CARROTS FOR COOKING

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.en:
Tuyana is single. She lives with her mother and helps her as her Mom is retired and has some health issues. They live in Berdyansk which is a resort town in the south of Ukraine. Tuyana runs a small enterprise selling women’s clothing, bijouterie, scarves, socks, leggings, etc. in the central market of her home town. She has been in this trade for 15 years and has gained much experience working in this sphere of business. Presently, Tuyana has about 18,000 Grivnyas in working capital. Her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tuyana is seeking a loan of 8,700 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. She is hoping to use additional funding to grow and expand her trade and her income as a result. Tuyana is an entrepreneur of integrity. Her professional management skills and friendly customer service have ensured her business a stable standing in this market niche.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise and turnover capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La sra. Rosario se dedica a la confección D. edredones, sábanas, y ahora está elaborando carameleros en forma D. muñecos D. nieve, es una cliente antigua y puntual, es muy conocida en la zona por sus productos que son D. muy buena calidad; sus hijos ya son independientes vive en la casa con su hija menor que recién tuvo su bebé, su esposo se encuentra en la ciudad D. Sucre por problemas D. salud. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. tela polar para la elaboración D. los muñecos ya que tiene pedidos para las fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Rosario makes quilts and sheets. Now she is making snowmen to fill with candy and sell. She is a long time, punctual client. She is very well known in the region for her very good quality products. Her children are now independent. She lives in her youngest daughter’s house. This daughter just had a baby. Her husband is in the city of Sucre because of health problems. The loan is to buy by fleece to make the snowmen. She has orders for the Christmas holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fleece

loans.name: Francisco Rejis

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco C. vive en el Barrio de Marambure de Luque con sus tres hijos ya  todos mayores. Tiene una carpinteria en su domicilio hace  mas de diez años, en dicho taller fabrica muebles de todo tipo contribuyendo asi al ingreso familiar a traves de este rubro. El crédito de la Fundación Pya. Lo destinó a la compra de un motor para su cepilladora de madera.

loans.use: Para la compra de un motor para una cepilladora de madera

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy M. vive en la ciudad de Aregua, esta casado con Fidelina Esquivel hace mas de diez años con quien tuvo dos hijos ambos menores aun. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos electrónicos, accesorios para automóviles entre otros productos desde hace mas de doce años. El crédito de la Fundación Pya. lo destinó en parte a la refacción de su vivienda y a la compra de mercaderías. A través del comercio puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia como también como también refaccionar  su vivienda .
texts.en:
Mr. Fredy M. lives in the city of Aregua. He has been married for ten years to his wife Fidelina Esquivel, and they have two children, who are both minors and under their care. For 12 years Fredy has worked as a traveling salesman, selling electronics and car accessories, among other products. The loan from la Fundación Pya. will be used for the refurbishment of his home and also for the purchase of merchandise to sell. Through the retail business, Fredy is able to provide for the basic necessities of his family and also earn money to improve his family home.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his home, to purchase electronic products and car accessories for later resale.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsable en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donD. se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SAN MIGUEL", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 4º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias responsables y activas, son muy unidas entre ellas,  como presidenta esta  la señora Magda G. P. ,ella es lider D. su grupo,muy sociable,  tiene tienda D. barrio en su domicilio venD. almuerzos, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como transportista. Como tesorera esta la socia Dominga C. quien es, muy responsable es casada tiene 4 hijos ella tiene su tienda D. barrio,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Patricia V. es soltera estudiante no tiene hijos el credito lo utiliza para aumento D. capital en venta D. productos AVON.

loans.use: AUMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas R. vive en la ciudad de Aregua, esta casado con Teodosia Gutierrez hace mas de treinta años con quien tuvo tres hijos ya  todos mayores. Tiene una despensa en su domicilio y tambíen se dedica a comercializar granos de maiz . El crédito de La Fundación Pya. lo destinó a la compra de artículos  comestibles para aumentar su inventario y  lograr asi un aumento en su ingreso familiar a traves del comercio.

loans.use: Para la compra de artículos comestibles, a granel y mercerias en gral.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
In 2006, Heidi and her husband decided that they were tired of working for other people and wanted to earn money on their own. Once they found a coffee shop for sale on the internet, they knew buying it was the perfect chance to take. Over the last three years, they have invested significant amounts of time and money into renovating the cafe, even cashing in their 401k. Many of the cafe's customers  had left when the cafe became run-down, before Heidi and her husband bought it. Their hard work has paid off - they have been able to get back many old customers, who remark how positive the new management has been for the business. 

They will use this ACCION USA loan to help remodel their kitchen so that they can add new equipment, like a deep fryer and a basic stove, to add more food items like soups, sandwiches, and french fries to their menu. With these new items, they think they can increase their profit margin.

In the past, Heidi has used credit cards as a cash cushion/emergency fund when unforeseen expenses come up, but she says that interest rates are so high nowadays that the convenience is not worth the price. She is thankful that she was able to receive the ACCION USA loan so that she will not have to pay so much interest. 

In the future, Heidi plans to grow the coffee by opening up in more locations and possibly roasting her own coffee beans. She looks forward to the day when she can hopefully pass the business down to her children!

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling and cooking equipment

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El cliente es el Sr. Marcelino G. Chamorro es casado tiene un hijo posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Es microempresario propietario de un local comercial en Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a la de artículos de primera necesidad, bebidas, artículos de bazar etc.
 Cuenta con 2 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos la misma es cliente recurrente de la sucursal, el destino de la operación será para compras de mercaderías de primera necesidad harina, azúcar, bebidas en cantidad que le estaría saliendo en menor precio y que le generará mayor ganancia lo cual se le otorgo 5MM a 12 meses.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías de primera necesidad harina, azucar, aceite.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Approvisionner son magasin

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es una mujer trabajadora y muy colaboradora, vive en el distrito D. Manantay, tiene 49 años y es madre D. cinco hijos, D. los cuales tres son mayores D. edad y dos son menores, se dedica a la venta D. granos como frijol , arroz, maíz, ella venD. en el puerto D. Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, él se dedica a la venta D. madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazareth” desD. hace seis años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en abarrotes, ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar granos. La meta D. Martha es  tener una tienda D. abarrotes en general.

loans.use: compra de granos para luego venderlo en los mercados.

loans.name: Bestsi

texts.es: Betsi es una joven y dinámica mujer, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 21 años y se dedica a la venta de caldo de gallina, Juanes,  jugos y gaseosas, cuenta con el apoyo de su prima quien le ayuda en esta actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado para implementar su negocio como comprar mesas, sillas, vitrina, y productos que necesita para la venta en pequeño negocio. La meta de Betsi es  tener un restaurante y bien implementado.
texts.en:
Betsi is a young, dynamic lady, she lives in the town of Pucallpa, she is 21 years old and sells chicken soup, "Juanes", juices and pops. She is supported by her cousin who helps selling. She has been a member of "Banco Comunal "Jesús de Nazareth" for two years. Her first credit of 300 soles was invested in pops and now she needs a loan of 2000 soles to be spent on setting up her business buying tables, chairs, showcase, and products to be sold at her small business. It is Betsi's goal to own a well installed restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in setting up a restaurant.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: El Sr. Celestino tiene 71 años esta casado con la señora Atanacia  de 67 años,cuentan con 1 hijo que esta casado  y  es estudiante. El señor trabajo mucho tiempo en la Argentina como empleado, se caso y decidio volver a su pais para posteriormente dedicarse a la venta de accesorios para guitarras. Actualmente cuenta con varios clientes formados ya que la zona en donde vive la gran mayoria se dedica a la confeccion de guitarras. Le gustaría que las autoridades inviertan mas su tiempo en salud, trabajo,  educacion y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mr. Celestino is 71 years old and married to Mrs. Atanacia of 67. They have 1 son who is married and a student. Don Celestino worked for a long time as an employee in Argentina where he got married and then decided to return to his country. Afterwards he sold guitar accessories for a living. At the present he counts on several customers as people in the area where he lives mostly make guitars for a living. He would like the authorities to invest more time in health, work, education, and security.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pegboxes and guitar strings.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, Provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 50 años y una hija mayor de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace tres años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en prendas de vestir, Marina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles que será invertido en productos de belleza. El sueño de Marina es mejorar su negocio y comprarse un carro
texts.en:
Marina is an entrepreneurial and hard-working lady. She lives in the town of Pucallpa, Province of Coronel Portillo, she is 50 years old and has a grown-up daughter. She sells beauty products and clothes for a living. She has been a member of "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Galácticas II" for three years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in garments. Marina needs a loan of 3000 soles to be invested in beauty products. It is Marina's dream to improve business and buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des outils de travail

loans.name: Doylalita

texts.es: Doylalita es una mujer colaboradora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 35 años, es madre de tres menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de condimentos y abarrotes en el mercado de Micaela Bastidas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en una empresa privada. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas” desde hace dos años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en condimentos.  En la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos. La meta de Doylalita es tener un negocio en su casa de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Doylalita is a collaborating and dynamic lady. She lives in the town of Pucallpa, province of Coronel Portilla. She is 35 years old and a mother of three young children. She sells condiments and groceries for a living at the market of Micaela Bastidas. She is supported by her husband who works at a private company. She has been a member of "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Galácticas" for two years. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in condiments. Presently she needs a loan of 1000 soles to be spent on buying sugar, rice, milk, and noodles. Doylalita's goal is to set up a general store at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying sugar, rice, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des une machine à coudre

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora MARTHA YOLANDA D. I. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en el distrito de MACHE , provincia de OTUZCO, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.  Es madre soltera  tiene un hijo de 21 años a quien lo apoya económicamente porque se encuentra estudiando en una Universidad de Trujillo.
Presenta estudios hasta 6to de Primaria porque desde pequeña se dedicó junto con sus hermanos y padres al campo, luego al quedar embarazada a los 18 años de edad y al no contar con el apoyo del padre de su hijo se dedicó a trabajar en casa, luego empezó a  criar cuyes y vender hasta poco a poco, y con gran esfuerzo, logró tener su tienda de abarrotes y útiles de escritorio.
MARTHA   se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios y útiles de escritorio en la tienda que  tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles empezó a comprar sus primeros útiles de escritorio: cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores, goma , colores, etc
Con el crédito de 1,000 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios al mayor como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente, jabón, gaseosa, etc para abastecer su tienda.
MARTHA sueña con abastecer su tienda y tener todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan para poder vender mas y obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: compra de productos alimenticios : arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente, jabón, gaseosa, etc

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Canton Camache Chiquito Group

texts.es:
Grupo de personas trabajadoras de la comunidad deCanton Camache Chiquito, Santo Tomas La 						
Union Suchitepequez, que viven en condiciones  económicas precarias la cual ellas						
con el tiempo han venido superando las condiciones en las se encuentran, atreves de sus						
negocios que emprendieron hace tres años como crianza de animales, tales como cerdos,						
pollos y  venta de blusas, zapatos de hule y como también venta de cacao, la cual estas 						
personas  iniciaron sus  negocios  con la visión de ser  personas ejemplares						
atrabes de apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan un nivel académico aceptable, y así el mejoramiento de sus 						
condiciones de vida, y para lograr alcanzar esta visión se vieron en la necesidad de acudir 						
a la asociación Asdir, a realizar un préstamo que les sirva del fortalecimiento de su capital e						
incremento de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
A group of working women who live in unstable economic conditions of the community of Canton Camache Chiquito, Santo Tomas La Union Suchitepeques . They have improved the conditions with the businesses they started three years ago, such as breeding pigs and chickens, selling blouses, rubber shoes, cacao. They started their businesses with the idea of being model individuals supporting their children to get acceptable academic studies and thus improve their living conditions. To reach this goal they found it necessary to approach Asociación Asdir to obtain a loan to strengthen their capital and increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús M. tiene 47 años. Su estado civil es casada, junto a su compañera de vida tienen 2 hijos a su cargo, su esposo labora como operador de maquinaria ya ambos tratan de buscar el medio de vida para que sus hijos puedan tener el pan de cada día. La actividad económica de Teresa en un cafetín, hace más de 12 años que trabaja en este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en el ingenio. Es una mujer que ha logrado muchas cosas y todo a base de sacrificios. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos y gaseosas. Su deseo es mantener siempre su negocio ya que es la única manera en la que puede obtener ingresos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter un séchoir

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 52 años, es madre de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, ella  tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes en general y bebidas, también se dedica a la costura, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es cerrajero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo que obtuvo  fue de 300 soles que invirtió en una vitrina para exhibir las golosinas.  En la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo de 2,500 que será invertido una parte en productos para  su tienda como arroz, leche, yogurt, fideos, azúcar, etc. y la otra parte  invertirá en gaseosas. La meta de Rayda es tener una tienda bien implementado de abarrotes.

loans.use: Invertirá una parte en productos para  su tienda como arroz, leche, yogurt, fideos, azúcar, etc. y la otra parte  invertirá en gaseosas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her shop with new products

loans.name: Hermelinda E.

texts.es:
La señora HERMELINDA E. V. D. C. tiene 52 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. MACHE , provincia D. OTUZCO, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú. HERMELINDA es casada La empresaria presenta estudios Hasta 6to D. primaria, porque desD. esa edad empezó a dedicarse al campo . HERMELINDA se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios en la pequeña tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa. Viaja a Trujillo y compra los productos mas baratos para poder tener mayores ganancias.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles viajo a Trujillo y compro  arroz, azúcar, jabones, aceite , papel higiénico, gaseosas y golosinas.
 Con este crédito D. 3,000  soles lo invertirá en la compra D. mas productos alimenticios para surtir su tienda D. comestibles que tiene en su casa. HERMELINDA  sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. HERMELINDA VILLACULCA D. C. is 52 years old. She lives in the district of MACHE, province of OTUZCO, department of La Libertad, Peru. HERMELINDA is married. The entrepreneur studied until 6th graD. when she started farming. For a living, HERMELINDA sells groceries from the small store at her house. She travels to Trujillo to buy the products at a cheaper price in order to increase earnings.

With her first loan of 300 soles she traveled to Trujillo and bought rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, toilet paper, pops, and candy.

With this loan of 3,000 soles she will invest in buying more groceries to supply her store. HERMELINDA dreams of making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying more groceries to supply general store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer colaboradora y alegre, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, tiene 43 años y es madre de seis hijos de los cuales cuatro son mayores de edad y dos menores, se dedica a vender frutas de la región como aguajes, cocos, coconas, etc, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es miembro de seguridad de una empresa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Trabajadoras de los Pinos” desde hace un año y cuatro meses. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 500 soles que invirtió en frutas.  
Este crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado una parte para mejorar su kiosco y otra para comprar las frutas. La meta de Esther es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general.

loans.use: Invertirá una parte para mejorar su kiosco y otra para comprar frutas.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es un mujer activa y luchadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 34 años y es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales como Juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas), tacachos (plátano aplastado), chorizos, etc., cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el puerto de Pucallpa vendiendo artículos de pasamanería. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace un año y cinco meses. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en artículos de pasamanería ahora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que será invertido una parte en productos para su venta de comida y otra parte invertirá en artículos de pasamanería. La meta de Ruth es tener un restaurante y seguir apoyando a su esposo en el negocio.

loans.use: Invertirá en artículos de pasamanería.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una persona emprendedora y que lucha por sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo,  tiene 47 años de edad, madre de cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida (platos regionales) por las noches, también se dedica a la costura, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es docente de educación, pero también la ayuda a Nancy en su negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas” desde hace ocho años donde se caracteriza por ser una socia puntual. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en gaseosas.  Con este crédito de 1000 soles, una parte la utilizará para comprar arroz, azúcar por sacos, aceite, y otra parte será para la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos. La meta de Nancy es comprarse una remalladora y aumentar sus pedidos para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nancy is an enterprising woman who fights for her ideals. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in Coronel Portillo Province. Nancy is 47 years old and the mother of 5 adult children. She sells food (regional dishes) at night and also works as a seamstress. She has the support of her husband, who is a teacher and also assists her with her business.

Nancy has been a member of the Communal Bank “Siete Estrellas” (Seven Stars) for the past 8 years. She is known for being a punctual member. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy sodas.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Nancy will use part of the loan to buy rice, sacks of sugar, and oil. The other portion will be used to buy fabric, thread, and elastics. Her goal is to purchase an overlocking machine (for making buttonholes) and increase her orders so that she can generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of the loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, and oil; the remainder will be used to buy fabric, thread, and elastics

loans.name: Elita

texts.es: Elita es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la cuidad de Pucallpa, tiene 42 años, es madre de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, ella tiene una tienda en su casa  donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es operador de maquinaria pesada en un aserradero. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, en la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo de 1700 soles que le permitirá invertir en artículos para su tienda como fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc. La meta de Elita es llegar a tener una distribuidora de bebidas y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Invertirá en artículos para su tienda.

loans.name: Medalith

texts.es:
Medalith es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 42 años, es madre de seis hijos todos mayores de edad y se dedica a la venta de sábanas, edredones, colchas actividad que la realiza todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es chofer de motocarro. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fruto Bendito” desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de pescado para vender.
Medalith necesita un préstamo de 1300 soles que será invertido en la compra de ropa de cama como: sábanas, colchas, edredones. La meta de Medalith es tener un local propio donde pueda vender artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Medalith is an enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in the Coronel Portillo Province. She is 42 years old and the mother of six adult children. Medalith sells sheets, quilts, and bedspreads every day. She has the support of her husband, who is a motorcar driver. For the past 2 years, she has been a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito” (Blessed Fruit). Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy fish to sell.

Medalith needs a loan of 1300 soles to buy bedding such as sheets, quilts, and bedspreads. Her goal is to have her own store where she can sell home furnishings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets, quilts, and bedspreads

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura es separada . La misma antes se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y verduras en la calle, o sea vendedora ambulante, como le iba muy bien e hizo de muchos amigos que le decían que también incursiones en otro rubro. Un día se decidió en vez de vender frutas y verduras, vender perfumes de marca renombrada donde su ganancia iba a ser mayor, hace aproximadamente 1 año que esta metida en la venta de perfumes que fue donde invirtió el ultimo credito que retiró de la Fundaciòn Paraguaya.
Mas adelante quiere ampliar el stock de fragancias y asì ampliar tambien su clientela
texts.en:
Laura is separated. She used to sell fruits and vegetables on the street or as a street vendor. As that was going well, and she made many friends, they told her that she should also get into another field. One day she decided that instead of selling fruits and vegetables, she would sell brand name perfumes where her earnings would be greater. After about one year of selling perfumes, which is where she invested her last loan, she retired from the Fundación Paraguaya. Later, she wants to increase her stock of fragrances and that way also increase the number of customers she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy all types of perfume to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Accroître la capacité de son commerce

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis A. C. tiene la actividad económica de elaboración de fotografía. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo. José Luis comenzó con este negocio con muy poco capital porque tenía que comprar cámaras de video cámara de fotografía por lo que tenía que tener la mejor tecnología y así ofrecerles a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, el disfruta mucho de su trabajo ya que en lo cumpleaños, bodas, quince años,  bautizos y otros eventos el elabora sus propias tarjetas de presentación y las distribuye a los invitados y es así que ha logrado obtener sus clientes. A pesar de tener las dificultades que ha enfrentado ha sido un fotógrafo reconocido. El financiamiento que ha solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra hardware, sistema de impresión, revelado y ciertos materiales para ofrecer una muy buena calidad de fotografías. Su deseo es de mejorar cada día en este trabajo.
texts.en:
José Luis A. C. has been involved in photography for over 20 years. He started his business with very little capital. He purchased video cameras so that he could have the best technology and offer his customers with high quality products. José Luis greatly enjoys what he does and has already performed work for birthdays, wedding, quinceaños (girl’s 15th birthday celebrations), baptisms, and other events. He also makes his own business cards that he distributes to guests at these events so that he can secure more customers.

Despite the difficulties he has faced, José Luis has established a reputation as a recognized photographer. The loan he requested will be used as operating capital to buy hardware, a printer, film developing supplies, and other materials that will help him produce good quality photographs. He hopes to improve each day at his job.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase equipment & supplies

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, tiene 37 años y es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales dos son mayores de edad y tres menores, se dedica a la venta de frutas en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es agricultor. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Trabajadoras de los Pinos” desde hace un año y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 500 soles que invirtió en la compra de frutas de la región.  Ahora ella necesita un préstamo de 1200 que será utilizado en la compra de mesas y frutas. La meta de Reyna es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Reyna is a dynamic and collaborative woman who lives in the district of Campo Verde. She is 37 years old and the mother of 5 children, of whom 2 are adults while the other 3 are still minors. Reyna sells fruit from her home, a business that she engages in every day. She has the support of her husband, who is a farmer. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mujeres Trabajadoras de los Pinos” (Working Women of the Pines) for a year and four months. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to by regional fruits.

She now needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy tables and more fruit. Reyna’s goal is to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & more fruit

loans.name: Heriberto Alejandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Heriberto tiene 47 años esta casado con la señora Benita  de 46 años,cuentan con 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio.
